Abena and her husband have two children, and she uses her income to support her husband in paying the children’s school fees and supporting other family expenses.  

Abena will use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of the necessary ingredients to run her doughnut-making enterprise, such as flour, sugar, and cooking oil. 

With the new profit from her expanded business, Abena plans to save money and to continue to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for making doughnuts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is a fish vendor. She also runs a general store business to earn additional income. She and her husband have one child, and she works hard to help support her family.

Ana Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 13,000 through NWTF, which she will use to buy additional boxes of fish to offer for sale.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Yom Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of two members: Agnes and Ajo. They sell charcoal and gari, respectively. They have been taking out loans together since 2007. 

Agnes, age 45, sells charcoal to earn an income. She has been with ID Ghana for the past six years and her business is doing very well. She has been engaged in this business for 15 years now and works Mondays through Saturdays, a routine she has learned from her mother. She is grateful for ID Ghana’s training on savings, and feels that she would not have made it this far without it. 

This is her eleventh loan. She is requesting GHS 1,500 in order to buy bags of charcoal to offer for sale to her customers. 

Together, Agnes and Ajo are requesting a total amount of GHS 2,200, which they will use to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Alice  B.

texts.en:
Alice B., age 33, runs a table market business to earn her living. Her mother helped her to establish her business. 

Alice and her husband have three children between the ages of 13 and 18. They are all enrolled in school and doing very well in their studies. Alice herself was unable to attend school. The family lives in Montserrado County, which is has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. 

Alice is requesting a loan in order to purchase more charcoal, peppers, rice, oil, vita, and other such items to expand her business. 

In the near future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, peppers, rice, oil, vita, and other such items

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi earns an income by extracting palm oil and kennel oil and offering these for sale. Her business is located at the market at Asafora, near Cape Coast.  

Esi is not married, so she uses her income to support herself. She pays all her living and accommodation bills on her own.  

Esi will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and palm kennel from which she will extract oil to offer for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Esi wishes to buy a machine to extract the oil more easily by herself. The investment will allow her to expand her business through this improved efficiency.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and palm kennel from which she will extract oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 19, manages a retail shop where she sells soft drinks and food items to earn an income. She has been engaged in this venture for two years. She lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. 
 
To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan in the amount of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan funds will be used to buy more passion fruits for making juice, soda, and water. This investment will help Mary generate greater profits, which she will use to support her family. 

Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more passion fruits for making juice, soda, and water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy accessories to make clothing for resale.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory raises sows and hogs to earn an income. She currently has two sows and 16 hogs. She has been engaged in this business for 15 years. In addition to her livestock business, Glory raises corn and rice crops within her own locality.

Glory's husband is a farmer and they are blessed with four grown children. Glory and her husband both work hard in order to have productive and profitable businesses. Profits gained from Glory's livestock business are applied to their rice and corn farm and to their household expenditures. For this reason, she struggles with a shortage of capital. She is therefore seeking financial support in the form of a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000. Her loan funds will be used to buy vitamins, vaccines, and eight bags of hog feed. 

Glory is confident that these livestock supplies will ensure the proper nutrition of her animals and will eventually bring her a good profit.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and eight bags of hog feed

loans.name: Zapha

texts.en:
Zapha has been running a retail general store business for the past seven years. She generates additional income through selling new clothing and jewelry. She runs her business from a rented shop and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges are the transportation of commodities from Kampala city to her shop, as well as seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler.

Zapha is the single mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her parents, sister and brothers). Her goal is to see her children attain a university education. She owns her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills, and food for the family.   
 
Zapha has applied for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO in order to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice, beans, trays of eggs, and boxes of mineral water for her store.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice, beans, trays of eggs, and boxes of mineral water for her store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, age 49, sells food items such as rice, oil, peanuts, butter, and onions to earn an income. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from him. She has been running her venture for the past 10 years. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money every day to apply toward family expenses. 

Ruth lives in Montserrado County with her husband and their two children, ages 13 and 18. Both are enrolled in school. Montserrado County has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.

Ruth is requesting a loan in order to purchase rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter to offer for sale.

In the future, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter to offer for sale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, age 37, and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business together for the past 15 years. She earns PhP 3,000 daily, which she uses to support her children. The family lives in Ubay, Bohol. 

Emma is requesting a loan in order to buy fish netting, hooks, and nylon string. These will be used in catching fish. With the help of her loan funds, Emma will be able to buy these materials so that she can continue doing her business.

In the future, Emma hopes to expand her business. Her goal is to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish netting, hooks, and nylon string to be used to catch fish

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón tiene la edad de 41 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y cinco hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El trabaja desde hace muchos años en el cultivo de café. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ramón is 41 years of age, is married, and lives with his wife and five children. He has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and help with his coffee plantation. He wants to look after his crops properly, so that he can have a bigger harvest and therefore obtain greater income. 

Ramón has worked growing coffee for many years. In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his family’s quality of life and give them better financial stability, as well as to continue growing as a person and a coffee producer. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not received any prior loans from the state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him this loan with better repayment facilities and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata réside au Sénégal. C’est une femme mariée et qui évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 05 ans. Les produits qu’elle mette sur le marché sont essentiellement composés de tissus, de crèmes glacées, de bonbons et de divers autres produits consommables. D’ailleurs c’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle parvient à donner sa participation aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle est membre à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle avait bénéficié d’un crédit auparavant. Une fois de plus, elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 100.000 francs CFA destiné à l’achat de tissus à revendre.  Ce prêt a pour but de lui permettre de diversifier les produits de son activité. Son projet futur est relatif à son souhait de devenir une grande commerçante dans la vente de produits divers.
texts.en:
Aminata lives in Senegal. She is a married woman, and has worked in the retail sector for more than five years. The products that she sells are mainly fabrics, ice creams, candies and various other edible products.  It is thanks to this business that she has been able to contribute to covering her family’s day-to-day expenses. 

Aminata is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches, where she has already had one prior loan. This time she has requested a loan of 100,000 francs CFA, which she plans to use to buy fabric for resale. Her hope is that this loan will allow her to diversify the products sold by her business. In the future, Aminata’s plans are focused on her desire to become a successful retailer selling various products.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret sells charcoal to earn a living and has been engaged in this business for 12 years. She works from her home seven days a week. In addition to her charcoal business, she generates additional income by offering rental rooms. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.
 
Margaret and her husband have five children, only one of whom attends school. She also takes acre of her brother’s son. She owns her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills. 

She has applied for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

Margaret's goal is eventually to acquire a delivery van to ease her transportation difficulties. She also aspires to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a fishmonger.  She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them for sale.  Abena has been selling fried fish for five years now. She is married and has five children.  She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  Abena  will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to  fry for sale.  Abena will expand her business with the new profits from her increased capital investment.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Myrzagul

texts.ru: Мырзагуле 43 годa, жамужем , воспитала 4 детей. В 1997 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Мырзагула начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 1,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Мырзагулы на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы,25 голов овец и 3 голов лошади. Доходы от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов составляют примерно 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мырзагула обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп овец и коз. Доходы от кредита Мырзагула планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Myrzagul is 43 years old and she is married with four children.  In 1997, she began to raise livestock as a source of income for her family, a business she started with 1,000 som (KGS).  Today on her farm, she has two dairy cows, 25 sheep and 3 horses.  Myrzagul's income from the sale of dairy and meat products is approximately 12,000 som (KGS) per month.  With the goal of increasing her business in the future, Myrzagul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and goats.  She plans on using the income from this loan to improve her farm.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married with seven children; five them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Cissy has a retail shop, and has been in this business for eleven years.  She generates additional income from rental rooms and selling used clothes nears her retail shop.  Cissy works from her home, and sells to all categories of people, but on retail basis only. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, jerycans of cooking oil, maize flour, and crates of soda.  Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation, and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. 

She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop, and also to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, paying for electricity and water, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of bread, jerycans of cooking oil, maize flour and crates of soda.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has 5  children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees.

Efua sells maize porridge and doughnuts in the markets in and around Elmina. Efua has been selling these tasty breakfast treats for the past five years.   

Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize in large quantities for her porridge. She will also use part of her loan to purchase a larger quantity of flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnut enterprise. 

With the new profits from her developing businesses, Efua will expand her trades further.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for her porridge business, and flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnut business.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah is 40 years old and lives in the town of West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is married and has five children between the ages of 12 and 20 who live at home with her and attend school. 
For six years, she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local Market. Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy her ingredients by wholesale and has to buy retail, which is much more expensive. She likes the interaction with her customers and learned how to cook from her mother a long time ago. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business. In the future, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken feet, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
"Veronica lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has five children and has been doing this work for 25 years.  Her primary income sources are milk and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Keeping dairy cows for milk production!' Her biggest challenge is 'loosing an animal due to illness".The animal in the farm is named 'Murgusi.'

Veronica was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Knew about Juhudi from a daughter in the group.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to increase assets like dairy cows through getting financed by Juhudi.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Veronica replied 'Purchase a cow; thus more milk production.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Veronica owns the following: 'cow' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a petty trader.  She trades in children's dresses, ladies wear, underwear, brassieres and panties, as well as a variety of baby products. Esi has been trading these goods for the past three years now. She  lives at Asafora  near Cape Coast.   Esi  is single.   She uses her income to pay her utility and accommodation bills.  Esi will use her loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of children’s products, dresses, and underwear for resale.  With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to build a shop where she can present and sell her goods more easily to her customers.

loans.use: purchase children's products, dresses , underwear and ladies wear for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
After working for seven years for another barber shop, Rebecca realized that the moment was right to establish a shop of her own. The opportunity quickly presented itself – she received an offer to take over an existing barber shop in Hagerstown, Maryland. 

Rebecca accepted the offer, and in 2006 she established Becky’s Barber Shop. Currently, Rebecca is the owner-operator and works by herself. Her immediate goal is to grow her business. 

A loan of $10,000 will allow Rebecca to renovate her shop, purchase additional chairs, and hire one or two stylists. 

In the future, Rebecca hopes to purchase her own commercial space for the barber shop.

loans.use: to renovate her barber shop, purchase new chairs, and hire additional stylists.

loans.name: Marileni

texts.en:
Marileni is originally from Brazil and has been living in the United States for the past nine years. She has worked in the cleaning industry for seven years and with the same cleaning company for four years.
 
Marileni was recently presented with an opportunity to purchase the cleaning company that she has managed since October 2012. The company has been established for 12 years, serving 25 households in Montgomery County, Maryland.  The owner is selling the business because she would like to retire in her home country of Brazil. 

Marileni is ready to seize the opportunity, and she is actively working to increase the number of households and expects to finish the year with 60 households. She loves Brazilian music, soccer, and is working hard at her company.

loans.use: to purchase her own cleaning company

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory to export to Bolivia.

loans.name: Abdulvohid

texts.ru:
Абдулвохид проживает в Яванском районе. Ему 29 лет. Он женатый молодой человек. Абдулвохид является отцом двоих детей. Образование у него среднее. 
Абдулвохид вместе с братьями занимается разведением животных. Он закупает скот, разводит несколько месяцев и выводит их на рынок. Таким образом он зарабатывает на сегодняшний день. Абдулвохид разводит в основном крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. В этой области он шесть лет. В Яванском районе многие жители занимается именно этим видом деятельности, так как природа и окружающая среда позволяет заняться этим делом. Абдулвохид более шести занимается животноводством. И только сегодня он решился получить заем для расширения своей деятельности. 
Абдулвохид берет кредит для закупа коров, бычков, овец и коз с целью увеличения поголовья мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Abdulvohid lives in the Yavan region. He is 29 years old. He is a married young man. Abdulvohid is the father of two children. He has secondary education.

Together with his brothers, Abdulvohid works with animal husbandry. He purchases livestock, breeds them for some months, and then brings them at the market. This is the way he currently earns money. Abdulvohid especially breeds cattle at his home. He has been in this area for six years. 

In the Yavan region there are a lot of residents who work with exactly this type of activity, as the nature and environment allows this business. Abdulvohid has been working with livestock breeding for more than six years. Only now did he decide to take a loan to broaden his business. 

Abdulvohid takes a loan for the purchase of cows, bulls, sheep and goats with an aim to increase the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, dairy cows, bulls, sheep and goats for the purpose of animal breeding

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru:
Феруза 29 летняя жительница района Яван. Она замужем. Феруза является матерью пятерых детей. У них очень большая и дружная семья. Ее муж каждый год ездит на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Феруза имеет среднее образование.
Феруза вместе со своей семьей занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. В этой области она восемь лет. 
Феруза берет кредит для посева лука, картошки, помидоров, пшеницы и закупа удобрений, чтобы за счет полученной прибыли она смогла достроить свой дом.
texts.en:
Feruza is a 29 year old resident of the Yavan region. She is married. Feruza is the mother of five children. They have a very large and friendly family. Her husband goes to the Russian Federation every year as a migrant worker. 

Feruza has secondary education. Together with her family she works with sowing agricultural crops. She has been in this area for eight years. 

Feruza takes a loan for the sowing of onions, potatoes, tomatoes, wheat and the purchase of mineral fertilizers, in order to be able to build a house based on the income received.

loans.use: to sow onions, potatoes, tomatoes, wheat and to purchase mineral fertilizers, in order to be able to build her house based on the income received

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba operates this provisions store where she sells raw rice, sugar, and canned tomatoes,  among other goods. Aba’s store is located in  Asafora  near Cape Coast.  Aba  is married  and has eight children. Her husband is a farmer.  She has been a provisions store owner and operator for  several years now.  She uses her income to  help  her husband with the general upkeep of their family.

 Aba  will use her loan to purchase larger bags of rice and sugar as well as a greater quantity of other provisions to sell.  With the new profit,  Aba plans to acquire a larger place to serve her customers.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice,  sugar and other provisions to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  is married with five children; all her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family

She has had a mini-bakery  for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil, cow peas, cassava, and baking flour. She works at the market six days a week, and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include defaulters, and ever increasing price of cooking oil and baking flour.  

She is aspires to own a fully stocked bakery, and also to get enough profit to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour, cooking oil, cowpeas, and cassava for making cassava chips.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua lives together with her husband and three children in Asafora  near  Cape Coast. She sells a variety of foodstuffs including maize, corn dough and also fried fish. Ekua has been selling food for the past 10 years now.  She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their family's utility and accommodation bills. 

Ekua  will use her loan to purchase large bags of maize for her corn dough and also to buy more fish to fry and  sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua wants to expand her business further in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her corn dough and also buy more fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera. se dedica  a prestar servicios de profesora en diferentes centros escolares (interinatos)  ella ha estudiado la docencia y tiene un promedio de 3 años de estarla ejerciendo.
También se dedica a la crianza de ganado pecuario. Actualmente, no cuanta con ningún semoviente; ya que en la temporada de diciembre vendió los dos que tenia.
Esta actividad de la crianza del ganado la aprendió de sus padres, que también se dedican ha esta activad tiene un promedio de 7 años de ejercerla, los semovientes los crían en un potrero que se encuentra a la par de su casa de habitación.   

Los semovientes para la crianza, los compra en los tiangues aledaños a la zona donde ella vive ,  que se encuentra a una distancia de su casa de habitación según sea el rumbo de un promedio de 10 kilómetros de distancia.      

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 semovientes para la crianza. La principal necesidad a satisfacer, es que podrá comprar su hato de ganado para la crianza ya que cuanta con un terreno apropiado para ejercer esta actividad, como también para que los semovientes tengan el pasto adecuado para su respectada crianza  
  
Al comprar 3 semovientes, que es la idea principal que tiene  para posteriormente venderlos; con la ganancia que esta actividad le genere es seguir aumentando su hato,  por que siempre esta trabajando con créditos de la fundación campo y su ganancia la ira invirtiendo en su negocio 
 
Ella desea continuar, con la crianza de ganado y diversificar sus productos; debido a que también menciono que quiere sembrar maíz y frijol, ya que se acerca la temporada de invierno  y es propicia para estas actividades.
texts.en:
Reina, 28, is single.  She makes a living as a temporary teacher in various schools.  She has studied teaching and has an average of three years in the profession.

She also raises cattle.  Currently she has no cattle because she sold her two animals in December.  She learned the work of raising cattle from her parents, who also make a living in this activity.  She has been doing this work for an average of seven years.  She raises the cattle in a pasture next to her house.  She buys the cattle to raise in the fairs in the neighboring areas, which average about 10 kilometers from her house.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy three cattle to raise.  The main need to satisfy is to be able to buy her cattle herd to raise because she has an appropriate plot of land for this activity and the cattle will have adequate pasture for raising.  

After she buys the three cattle, her main idea is to sell them later.  With the profit she earns from this activity she'll continue increasing her herd because she's always working with loans from Fundación Campo and she'll keep on investing her profits in her business.

She wants to continue raising cattle and diversify her products.  She also mentioned that she wants to grow corn and beans because the winter is approaching and it's favorable for these activities.

loans.use: to buy three cattle to raise

loans.name: Giselle

texts.es: Giselle tiene  30  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y cuatro hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Giselle is 30 years old, married, and currently lives with her husband and four children. 

With the loan, she hopes to buy supplies such as manure, pesticides, and, in turn, help her with the labor. She is thinking of maintaining the plantations so that they are not harmed and do not lower their production. With her coffee-growing project she can earn more income to support her family. 

She has a small amount of money, but not enough for this purchase nor the contracts. For this reason and no means to get the money for it, she is requesting a loan. It is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has never had any other loans from other state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan with great terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a single mother of four children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Teddy has a restaurant business and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO  to buy more bunches of green bananas, cooking oil, beef, beans, fresh cowpeas and fish.  

Teddy works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  

She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, fresh cowpeas and fish.

loans.name: Francess

texts.en:
Francess is 47 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is a widow and has six children between 19 and 30 years old. Her children are in school, and only one lives at home.

For the past 20 years, Francess has been selling door locks, nails, hinges, door-catches, etc. in the local market. Some problem she is facing is the rainy season.

Francess is requesting a loan to purchase door locks, nails, hinges, door-catches, etc. for her business. 

She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and   build a house.

loans.use: to purchase door locks, nails, hinges, door-catches, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona takes care of her two elder sisters, one living in a nursing home, the other at home. “My heart goes out to them,” she says. “I just want to do something to make them feel joy and comfort.”

Witnessing how her family, like so many others, struggles to find enough time to care for their immediate families and to care for their extended family members, Ramona saw a need for caregivers in her hometown of Gretna, Louisiana. Through her church, she initially began caring for others as a volunteer.

“I go to nursing homes and do a church service, and it makes them feel happy. I think I get more out of it than they do,” she says. “Eventually, my turn will come and hopefully someone will be there for me.”

Ramona later decided to go into business as a caregiver. “I enjoy it,” she says. “One day a week wasn’t enough for me.” She says the families of those she cares for don’t neglect them, but simply have their own lives and limited time in every day. “I can’t explain the joy it gives me,” she says. 

Ramona, who recently turned 53, launched her business, Compassionate Angels, LLC, the last week of January 2012. It’s a business she calls “compassion-ship” for the elderly. 

A quick visit to the Louisiana Small Business Development Center inspired Ramona to inquire about a loan from Accion Texas Inc. Upon approval, she was able to purchase computer supplies and QuickBooks, an accounting software package for small businesses. “It kind of gives me the comfortable feeling that I have backup. For example, just in case a client hasn’t paid yet, I can still continue their care without interruption.”  

Accion helped Ramona immensely and educated her with useful advice for future business needs, she says. She’s taking her business day by day, but plans to hire another compassionate caregiver as she gains more clients. 

Through her experience with the elders she cares for, Ramona says she’s learned how time has changed family values, but also how to keep close family ties during times of a generation that rushes the day. Find out more at http://compassionateangels.com/.

loans.use: to purchase computer supplies and QuickBooks, an accounting software package for small businesses.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells cassava and palm fruits at Asafora, near Cape Coast. She has been selling these staple foodstuffs for 13 years now. 

Efua is a widow and has four children. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. 

Efua will use her loan to purchase more foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, and palm fruits to sell in the markets. 

With the new profit from her loan, Efua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, and palm fruits to sell.

loans.name: Las Soñadoras Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS SOÑADORAS , Está  compuesto por once integrantes ocho mujeres y tres varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Ritha tiene 49 años dos hijos de las edades de 15 y 17 años,  La Sra. Ritha  se dedica a la venta y fabricación de artesanías en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma localidad donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ritha va a usar este préstamo para la compra materiales para la fabricación de sus artesanías,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Ritha va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda de artesanía grande y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela,  la Sra. Ritha es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: Las Soñadoras communal bank is made up 11 members, eight women and three men. Ritha, 49, is the president of the bank. She has two children, ages 15 and 17. Ritha works making and selling artisan handicrafts in her kiosk, located in the same town where she lives. This is her first loan from the institution. Ritha will use this loan to buy materials to make her crafts. Her reason for asking for this loan is to improve her business. Ritha will use her earnings to continue buying materials and increase her income. Her hope for her business is to have a large artisan store and this way be able to provide her customers with greater service. Ritha is a very hard-working person. She is glad for the opportunity that has been given to her and her fellow group members because in some cases they are supporting their families on their own.

loans.use: to buy materials to make artisan handicrafts.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 42 años, soltera con cuatro hijos de 11,20,22 y 23 años de edad solo el más pequeño estudia los demás trabajan, ella inicia su negocio a partir de la separación del padre de sus hijos, tuvo que emigrar de  una comarca a un municipio de Chinandega en busca de trabajo para mantener sus hijos porque era madre soltera y sin apoyo de nadie y por la carga de sus hijos no pudo encontrar trabajo pero con ayuda de una buena samaritana que acopiaba maíz le ofreció dicho producto al crédito con el que inicia su negocio de tortillería y con el tiempo puede realizar otro pequeño negocio como es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante y actualmente tiene 13 años de dedicarse al negocio y aunque no ha podido darle estudios profesionales a sus hijos pero son bachilleres y ellos aprendieron a trabajar por si solos, no es la primera vez que ella solicita crédito a nuestra institución tiene un excelente record crediticio ya que ha sido muy luchadora.  Esta inversión será una gran ayuda para tener los productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus tortillas e  inyectar capital a su venta de  ropa. Las aspiraciones son con respecto a su trabajo es contar con esta fuente de ingreso por vario tiempo, para lograr darle estudios profesionales a su hijo que aún está a su cargo. El financiamiento es para la compra de maíz, bolsas, cal y leña, ropa de niños, zapatos, calcetas, camisolines entre otros productos más. Vilma agradece la ayuda que le brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua
texts.en: Vilma, 42, is single and has four children, ages 11, 20, 22, and 23. Only the youngest one is in school. The rest are working. She started her business after separating from the father of her children. She had to move from one region to a town in Chinandega in search of work. She needed to support her children, since she was a single mother with no support from anybody and due to her children, she was unable to find work. But with the help of a good samaritan who gathered corn and offered her this product on credit, she started her tortilla business. With time, she was able to start another small business - selling clothing as a street vendor. Now she has been in this business for 13 years. Even though she was not able to help her children with their professional studies, they finished secondary school and learned to work for themselves. This is not the first time she has asked for credit through our institution. She has an excellent credit record, because she has been very determined. This investment will help her have the necessary ingredients to make her tortillas and invest capital in her clothing sales business. Her dream for her business is to have this source of income for a long time, and to help her child who still lives with her with his professional studies. The loan is to buy corn, bags, lime, firewood, children's clothing, shoes, socks, and camisoles among other things. Vilma is grateful for the help given to small businesses with few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her tortilla business, and to buy merchandise like children's clothing, shoes, camisoles, and skirts among other things

loans.name: Hugo Miguel

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la cálida y alegre ciudad de Chincha. Hugo desde muy joven es muy trabajador, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y tenía la necesidad de apoyarlos, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Hugo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno y cerdos, cada mañana el se levanta muy temprano ´para poder darles los alimentos a sus animales y limpiar el espacio donde los cría, es por ello que el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y sobre todo le gusta lo que hace.

Hugo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar animales como vacas, cerdos, corderos, entre otros, así como también comprar alimentos balaceados, de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir la casa de sus padres de material noble ya que actualmente viven en una vivienda de adobe”.
texts.en:
Hugo, 38, lives in the warm and lively city of Chincha. Hugo has been hard-working since he was young, since his parents had few economic resources and he needed to support them. This is why he was only able to finish the fifth year of secondary school, but he would like to have gotten a university degree. Every day, Hugo works in his small business buying and selling cattle and pigs. Every morning, he gets up very early to feed his animals and clean the space where he raises them. He believes things are going well for him in his business because he is very dedicated and above all, he likes what he does.

Hugo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they have given him, he will be able to buy animals like cows, pigs, and lambs, among others. He will also buy feed. This way, he will be able to increase his income and keep fighting to make his greatest dream a reality: "To build his parents a house out of quality materials since they currently live in an adobe house."

loans.use: to buy animals (pigs, cows, and lambs, among others) and animal feed.

loans.name: Saidou Mamma

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou Mamma est un agriculteur âgé de 46 ans qui exerce le métier depuis 9 ans. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants : son ainé a 18 ans et le cadet 9. Seydou Mamma est entré dans le maraichage par amour car il a la passion des plantes depuis tout jeune. Il est à son tout 1èr crédit car il veut acheter des intrants agricoles et grâce aux débouchés, améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
 C’est lui qui gère sa propre dépense quotidienne. Il a comme projet futur : d’acquérir une machine pompe à eau pour minimiser ses charges d’exploitation.
texts.en:
Saidou Mamma is 46 years old and has been working as a farmer for nine years.  He is married and the father of four children: his oldest child is 18 years old, his youngest is 9.  Saidou Mamma decided to grow produce because he has always had a passion for plants.  

This is his very first loan.  He will use it to buy agricultural inputs.  With his profits, he wants to improve his family's diet.

Saidou Mamma manages his own daily expenses.  In the future, he plans to buy a water pump, in order to minimize his operating costs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Naysha Edith

texts.es:
Naysha es una joven de 19 años de edad, la vivienda donde ella habita se encuentra en la ciudad de Imperial, la cual es una ciudad con un clima muy variado, en la cual se desarrolla la agricultura y el turismo. Naysha es una joven con mucha ganas de salir adelante a pesar de los obstáculos, con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de administración en un instituto de su ciudad, asimismo Naysha trabaja en una empresa de su ciudad como empleada y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a su padre con los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Naysha está muy agradecida con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestatarios Kiva ella podrá construir una escalera en su vivienda y también un pequeño cuarto en la vivienda de su padre, de esta manera ella podrá tener un mejor ambiente para vivir y podrá seguir esforzándose por brindarle a su padre una vida mejor y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Seguir estudiando y comprar una casa”.
texts.en:
Naysha, 19, lives in the city of Imperial, a city with a varied climate, where there is agriculture and tourism. Naysha is a young woman with a lot of motivation to advance in spite of obstacles. With a lot of effort, she was able to study a degree in Administration at an institute in her city. Naysha is also an employee at a business in the city and with her earnings, she helps her father with his home expenses. She believes that she is advancing because she is very responsible and she has a lot of desire to move forward.

Naysha is grateful to the support that Kiva lenders are giving her. She will be able to build stairs in her home as well as a small room in her father's home. This way, she will have a better environment to live in, and she can keep working to give her father a better life. She will be able to continue fighting to make her greatest dream a reality: "to continue studying and buy a house."

loans.use: to build stairs and a room

loans.name: Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SIN FRONTERAS , Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco mujeres y tres varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Deisy tiene 28 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 10 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida almuerzo en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Santa Rita  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Deisy va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos por mayor, como abarrotes y hortalizas para la elaboración de sus platillos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de insumos,  la Sra. Deisy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar la  sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de la misma para poder captar más clientes en las horas pico de almuerzo, la Sra. Deisy es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Sin Fronteras (Without Borders) communal bank is made up of eight members, five women and three men. The chair of the bank is Deisy. Deisy, 28, has two children, ages 4 and 10. She works selling lunch at her stand in Santa Rita. This is her first loan from the institution. Deisy will use the loan to buy wholesale ingredients, such as groceries and vegetables to make her dishes. Her reason for asking for this loan is the lack of money to buy ingredients. Deisy confronts challenges in her business, such as the climate conditions and the competition of other businesses. This is why she has to try to reduce her costs and improve the seasoning of her dishes. She is going to use the profits to buy utensils and also to attract more customers during peak lunch hours. Deisy is a very hard-working person. She is glad for this opportunity given through the credit.

loans.use: to buy ingredients wholesale to prepare food.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith's group is comprised of four hard working women. Judith is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Judith has been working hard to manage her hairdressing salon. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair cosmetics to treat more clients, and will help Judith to generate greater profits, meet her family's basic needs and save some money for future use. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy hair cosmetics to treat more clients.

loans.name: Gpf Pinal Bow Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement, Pinal Bow regroupe 3 femmes qui se sont rassemblés par affinités parce que vivant dans le même quartier. Elles ont à leur tête la dame Dieynaba Mallé, âgée de 46 ans et qui a  7 enfants dont l’ainé a 22 ans et le cadet 2 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus mais aussi de beignets. Elle a acquis une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Les bénéfices de l’activité lui serviront à épauler son mari dans les charges de la maison.
Madame Dieynaba Mallé désire avoir une ferme agricole pour cultiver afin de diversifier ses sources de revenus.
texts.en: The group Pinal Bow comprises three women who have come together by affinities, since they live in the same neighborhood. The women have as their group leader Dieynaba Mallé, aged 46, who has seven children; the oldest child is 22 years old, and the youngest is 2. She is active in selling cloth and also beignets. She has acquired ten years of experience in this domain. The business profits go toward helping out her husband to cover household expenses. Ms. Dieynaba Mallé would like to obtain a farm to cultivate, so as to diversify her sources of revenues.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to resell and to make beignets for sale

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 33 years of age and has been living with her partner for eight years. She is grateful because her partner is supportive of every decision she makes.

Leny manages a livestock, retail store and farming business. Being a responsible mother and partner, she aims to generate sufficient income to provide for  her family's requirements, ensure proper care of her two hectares of rice fields and expand her retail store. In this situation, she hopes to be a better entrepreneur someday. Leny would like to ask for additional capital of PHP 20,000 allowing her to buy hog feed and essential vitamins for her hogs and to re-stock her retail store with complete merchandise. Through her patience and commitment, she knows that she could improve her sales and profit. In addition, she could satisfy her customer's demand.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and essential vitamins for her hogs and to re-stock her retail store

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena prepares corn dough, kenkey, for sale in the markets in and around Elmina. In front of Abena is a large batch of the corn dough she prepares. She will cover small portions of the corn dough with banana leaves and sell these smaller packages to customers. This is the traditional kenkey recipe and the way Abena's mother made her kenkey when Abena was a child. Abena is married to a farmer in her community and they have nine children together. She uses her income to support her husband with the general upkeep of their family. Abena needs this loan to purchase larger bags of maize and banana leaves for her kenkey production. With the new profit Abena will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize and banana leaves for her kenkey (corn dough) production.

loans.name: Gpf Thialy-Maka Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Thialy-Maka est un groupe qui rassemble 4 femmes qui vivent dans le même quartier. Elles sont très débrouillardes et épaulent leurs maris dans la gestion de la maison. La présidente, madame Salimata Demba âgée de 53 ans a 9 enfants dont l’ainé a 34 ans et le plus jeune, 15 ans.  Elle fait du commerce depuis 7 ans en vendant  des produits divers. Elle vient solliciter pour la 5ème fois un crédit afin d’améliorer son commerce et satisfaire la demande.
 Elle a comme projet futur, d’acquérir une ferme pour faire de l’élevage en grande quantité.
texts.en: The Thialy-Maka credit group comprises four women who all live in the same neighborhood.  They are very resourceful and help their husbands to manage their households.  The leader of the group, Salamata Demba, is 53 years old and the mother of nine children between the ages of 34 and 15.  She has been involved in commerce for seven years and sells various goods.  She has requested a fifth loan in order to develop her small retail business and to meet her customers' demand.  In the future, she would like to buy a farm, in order to raise a large number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as palm oil, broomsticks...

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha's group is comprised of nine hardworking women. Aisha is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chickens and eggs.

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to stock more birds on the farm to sell. This will help her to generate greater profits, support her family's basic needs, and pay school fees for her young siblings. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to construct rental houses in town.

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more birds on the farm to sell.

loans.name: Diana Gisela

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer de 29 años, nació en un hogar de la Región Costa y siendo muy joven  emigró en busca de un mejor futuro a la Sierra ecuatoriana. Ahora vive con su pareja Iván de 34 años con quien tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años, ambos estudian y también ayudan en las labores de la casa. Son una familia muy unida y viven en una parroquia rural de la ciudad de Quito capital de la provincia del Ecuador, su nombre es Nanegalito, parroquia ubicada al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha, que fue residencia de una cultura ecuatoriana. Es un lugar poseedor de diversidad de flora y fauna y además ríos y cascadas. Su punto fuerte en la producción es la ganadería con la producción de leche y carne y también la agricultura con la producción de caña de azúcar, yuca, caña, maíz, naranjas, mandarinas y papayas. Las artesanías elaboradas a mano también son una oportunidad de negocio en el lugar, que son demandadas por el uso particular de materiales naturales como semillas del bosque. Por todo esto las autoridades locales se han preocupado por hacer instalaciones adecuadas para que todos sus más de 3000 habitantes tengan acceso a los servicios básicos que hasta hace poco no era un beneficio que todos gozaban.
Diana llegó a Nanegalito ayudando a su pareja en el campo, cultivando varios tipos de frutos y también cuidando animales para su posterior comercialización. Al ver la necesidad en su hogar, hace un año ella también decidió asumir el reto de criar cerdos para su posterior comercialización, aunque en una ocasión ya lo había intentado y no resultó como ella esperaba, no se ha dado por vencida.  Mejorando los criaderos y ocupando casi 10 horas al cuidado de los cerdos, Diana ha incrementado sus ingresos y ahora requiere un préstamo para comprar un par de cerdos adicionales para criarlos y así poder salir al mercado con más producto para cumplir con la demanda de los visitantes de la zona que siempre van en busca de lo mejor. Diana sueña con tener junto a su familia un futuro prometedor, convertirse en una microempresaria reconocida, para lo cual está adquiriendo varias herramientas gracias a la asesoría de Fundación Alternativa  y su ejecutivo de cuenta, en donde encontró el apoyo y confianza para tener un capital a través del producto Kiva en donde además ella consigue que sus proyectos de vida sean apoyados en todo el mundo.
texts.en:
Diana is a 29 year old woman who was born in a a home in the Costa Region, and emigrated to the Ecuadorian Sierra when she was very young in search of a better future. Now she lives with her partner, 34-year-old Iván, with whom she has two children, ages 14 and 6. They both study and also help with house work. They are a very united family and they live in a rural parish in the city of Quito, capitol of the province of Ecuador. The name of the parish is Nanegalito, located northwest of the Pichincha Province, which was the home of an Ecuadorian culture.

This place possesses a variety of flora and fauna, and also has rivers and waterfalls. Its strong point in production is cattle, with the production of milk and meat, as well as agriculture, with the production of sugar cane stalks, yucca, corn, oranges, tangerines and papayas. Hand crafts are also a business opportunity in the area, in demand for their particular use of natural materials such as seeds from the forest. Due to all of this, the local authorities have made it a point to do appropriate installations so that all of their over 3,000 inhabitants have access to basic services, which up until recently were not a benefit that all were able to enjoy.

When Diana arrived to Nanegalito she was helping her partner in the field, sowing various types of fruits and also raising animals to be sold. Upon seeing the amount of need in her household, a year ago she decided to also take on the challenge of raising pigs to be sold, even though on one occasion she had already tried and it had not turned out the way she had hoped. She had not given up. Improving the nurseries and spending almost 10 hours taking care of the pigs, Diana has increased her income and now she needs a loan so she can buy a couple of additional pigs to raise and that way she can go to the market with more products to meet the demand of the area's visitors who always go in search of the best.

Diana dreams of having a promising future along with her family and becoming a recognized micro entrepreneur. For this purpose she is acquiring several tools, thanks to the advice of Fundación Alternativa and its account executive. Via Fundación Alternativa, she found the support and trust to gain capital through the Kiva product, and this is where she also got her life's projects supported around the world.

loans.use: to buy pigs and supplies for raising them

loans.name: 4 De Marzo Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 4 DE MARZO está  compuesto por ocho integrantes, todas  mujeres,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Ruth tiene 43 años y es casada con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de  14 años, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos a la venta de patasca mote de maíz cocido ella vende en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ruth va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de maíz seco por mayor para hacer coser y poner a la venta y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con capital de trabajo ya que esta época sube de precio el maíz seco y ella quiere almacenar para no sufrir de su producto, la Sra. Ruth enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el  tener más clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios en  dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank 4 De Marzo (4th of March) is made up of 8 members, all of whom are women. The president of the communal bank is Ruth; she is 43 years old, married, and has one child who is 14 years old. 

She earns her living selling food and selling patasca mote de maíz cocido (a nutritious beef and lamb stew with corn). She sells these items in El Torno.

This loan is her first with the institution. Ruth will use this loan to buy dry corn in bulk so she can cook and sell it. This way she will increase her earnings at work. 

She is requesting the loan because she does not have enough money from her job since the price of dry corn has increased in the past few years. She wants to stock up on it so she does not hold up her product. 

Ruth faces challenges at her business like gaining more customers. She is also going to use the earnings to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to buy dry corn.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has three children and has been doing this work for eight years. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

She stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is 'faster returns from farming business!' Her biggest challenge is disease. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyangera.' She will use the loan to expand her tea plantation and grow trees around the farm to protect it from wind.

Everline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Convenient.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: ' how to make savings out of the loan.'

Her highest monthly expense is business related. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Everline replied, 'increase family income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Everline owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to grow a tea plantation and trees around her plantation

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: José Daniel, 44 años de edad casado con dos hijos de 24 y 17 años de edad solo el menor estudia, él se dedica a la pesca artesanal el cual lo realiza dos veces a la semana ofrece  variedades  de mariscos los cuales vende a acopiadores al mayor y al detalle a clientes fijos y eventuales da al crédito y recupera semanal, su jornada semanal es de setenta y dos horas (tres días) a la semana, el está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de dos trasmayos y también en la compra de hilo para reparar trasmayos
texts.en: José Daniel is 44. He is married and has two sons aged 24 and 17, of which only the youngest attends school. José is a traditional fisherman who goes out to sea twice a week and offers a wide range of seafood products. He sells to wholesalers as well as to retailers, to regular as well as to new customers. He sells on credit and recovers his money every week. He works 72 hours (3 days) a week and is asking for a loan to purchase two trammels and thread for fixing trammels.

loans.use: to purchase two trammels, thread to fix trammels and other supplies

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is the woman scooping soup from the pot. She operates a traditional African chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold). Aba has been a chop bar owner and operator for about 2 years now. Aba prepares traditional favorite dishes, including fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls. She is married and has 4 children. Aba uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other necessary ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new profit, Aba plans to expand her chop bar into a full fledged restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Elsy Noemi

texts.es:
Elsy tiene 24 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos, de 10, 8, 4 años de edad y uno de 10 meses todos son varones. se dedica  a la venta de diferentes artículos comestibles como se pueden mencionar los siguientes: sorbetes, papas fritas y pupusas. Ella los vende un su casa, ya cuenta con una clientela muy buena que son las personas que viven en su comunidad; esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace un promedio de 5 años.
Es madre soltera y ella sola vela por la manutención de sus pequeños niños dos de ellos asisten a la escuela a pesar de las limitantes tienen un techo digno y una buena educación.  

Para la elaboración de los diferentes comestibles que ella produce, la materia prima la compra en diferentes tiendas de la cuidad, donde le venden a precio de mayoreo que se encuentra  ha una distancia de 3 kilómetros de su casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 pintas de sorbetes, 3 cajas de cono de 100 unidades cada una, 3 quintales de papa, 3 garrafas de aceite de 5 botellas cada una, 10 quintales de maíz para la elaboración  de las pupusas, 5 libras de chicharón, 5 libras de quesillo, y sus respectivas verduras para hacer el ensalada (repollos, zanahorias, chile. etc.)

con la inversión, podra incrementar los inventarios para la elaboración de los diferentes productos que ella fabrica y de esta manera los clientes siempre le compraran; ya que hay ocasiones que  por falta de efectivo ella no puede comprar la  materia prima para la elaboración de los productos.   

Al poder vender todos los productos comestibles, los ingresos por venta serán mayores y de esta manera le podrá dar una educación mejor a sus 4 hijos, ya que ellos demandan otras necesidades que ella no las puede suplir por sus ingresos actuales.  
 
Entre sus planes esta el instalar una tienda, donde pueda vender productos de la canasta básica ya que las personas que viven en la comunidad son bastantes y tienen que salir del cantón para poder comprar. Otra meta a futuro que ella tiene es que sus 4 hijos tengan una educación buena para que puedan ser hombres de bien en el mañana.
texts.en:
Elsy, 24, has four children, ages 10, 8, 4 and 10 months, all boys. She makes a living selling different food items such as the following: sorbets, french fries and pupusas. She sells them in her home, and she already has a very good client base made up of the people who live in her community. She has been performing this work for about five years.

She is a single mother and she alone ensures the support of her small children, two of whom go to school despite limiting factors. They have a decent roof and a good education.

For the creation of the different food items that she produces, she buys the raw materials in different stores in the city where they sell to her at wholesale prices, at a distance of three kilometers from her house.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy three pints of sorbet, three boxes of 100 cones, three quintals of potatoes, three five-bottle carafes of oil, ten quintals of corn for making pupusas, five pounds of pork rinds, five pounds of cheese, and the respective vegetables for making salad (cabbage, carrots, chiles, etc.)

With this investment, she would be able to increase her inventory for the making of the different products that she creates and in this way her clients will always buy her products, since there are occasions on which - due to a lack of cash - she cannot buy the raw materials to make her products with. 

If she is able to sell all of these food products, her sales income will be greater and in this way she can give her four children a better education, since they have other needs she cannot meet due to her current income. Among her plans is the installation of a store, where she can sell basic needs products, since she lives with many people in the community and they have to leave the canton to be able to buy things. Another future goal she has is that her four children get a good education so that they can be good men tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy three pints of sorbet, three boxes of 100 cones, three quintals of potatoes, three five-bottle carafes of oil, ten quintals of corn for making pupusas, five pounds of pork rinds, five pounds of cheese, and the respective vegetables for making salad (cabbage, carrots, chiles, etc.)

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 40 years old and married. She was unable to attend school. For three years now she has been selling charcoal in her community. One of the problems that she faces is a small income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers, and the profit that she makes enables her to buy food for her home. It makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. In the near future she would like to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 39 years old. She has 4 children and works in agriculture. The loan will help her earn more income. Her customers are the community members and schools. Her dream is to take all of her children to school. Her challenge is the expensive chicken feed, which eats into her income. She is very hard working and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Elio

texts.es: Elio  tiene 49 años de edad, está soltero y vive con los padres. El crédito lo quiere para asistir una propiedad de doble propósito la cual tiene potreros, café y agricultura. El quiere asistir estas actividades con un poco mas de recursos debido a que ellos son de bajos recursos económicos. El se ha dedicado con su familia al cultivo de granos básicos complementado con la ganadería. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Elio is 49 years old, single and lives with his parents.  He wants the loan to assist with a property with multiple purposes , which has pastures, coffee and agriculture.  He wants assistance with these activities through more resources since they have few economic resources.  He has worked with his family in cultivating basic staple foods along with livestock.  This is his first loan with Fudecosur.  He has not had any other loans in state banks, but Fudecosur has offered the loan more easily and the interest rate much lower.

loans.use: support his farm (coffee, livestock, agriculture)

loans.name: Lusaria

texts.en:
Lusaria lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana-growing region. She has six children and has been doing this work for 25 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, tea, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Returns!” Her biggest challenge is “diseases.” Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Ingombe.”

Lusaria was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “convenient payment periods.”  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: “Importance of saving.”

Lusaria's highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Lusaria replied, “increase family income.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lusaria owns the following: “cow and poultry” but does not own “pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile”. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Lusaria has in the household “mosquito net, electricity, running water” but does not have “solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD.”

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter (chaff cutter).

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has 12 children and has been doing this work for 20 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, tea, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Returns!'. Her biggest challenge is 'lack of proper finance.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyabarati'.

Grace was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Convenient.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Loaning.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Grace replied 'Increase family income'.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Grace owns the following: 'cow' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 37-year-old single parent with a child. She sells edible palm oil (used for cooking stew). She resides at Sukura in Dansoman.

She has been in this business for the past 3 years and is still doing very well. She is very good and discreet when it comes to her business. 

This is her 3rd loan, and she needs GHS 500 to expand her business and enable her to buy more goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase catalogue products and casual garments

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells maize and cassava at Asafora near Cape Coast, which she has done for 3 years now. Aba is married and has 3 children. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding her family and paying for their children’s school fees. Aba will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and cassava to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Aba wants to personally cultivate the maize and cassava that she sells.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and cassava to  sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a fish monger and also sells soap and raw rice at Asafora near Cape Coast. She has been in this business for 3 years now. Esi is a single parent and has 4 children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe and pay school fees for her children. Esi will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry and boxes of soap and bags of rice to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry and boxes of soap and bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina, a 27-year-old woman lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County, with her two children and boyfriend. She did not attend school, but her children are attending school. For the past two years, she has been selling soap, toothpaste, candles, etc., from a table in the local market. Sometimes the sales are slow, but most of the time she realizes a profit, which she uses to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, toothpaste, candles, etc., to expand her sales. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, toothpaste, candles, etc., to expand her sales

loans.name: Kairiniza

texts.ru: Кайриниза 46 лет,замужем, имеет 4 детей. Они начинали свой бизнес с мужем в 1996 году. Несмотря на все житейские проблемы она остается все такой же жизнерадостной и веселой. Она твердо уверена в светлое будущее своей семьи. Кайриниза в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Кайриниза сумела развить свой бизнес с 10,000 KGS сегодня ежемесячный доход бизнеса составляет 7,000 сом (KGS).  Кайриниза ежегодно обрабатывает 2 га земли, где ежегодно сажает фасоль и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кайриниза обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита Кайриниза планирует вложить в расширение обрабатываемого поля и увеличения количества скотины. Она мечтает чтобы дети имели хорошую работу в будущем и хорошую семью.
texts.en: Kairiniza is 46 years old, married, and has four children.  She started her own business with her husband in 1996.  Despite the struggles of life, she remains lively and cheerful.  She strongly believes in a bright future for her family.  In order to provide a source of income for her family, Kairiniza makes her living working with livestock.  She began her business with 10,000 KGS.  Thanks to perseverance and hard work, the business now brings in 7,000 KGS a month.  Kairiniza also cultivates two hectares of land each year, raising beans and perennial grasses.  With the goal of further developing her business, Kairiniza has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 KGS to buy two bulls.  She plans to use the profits from the loan to expand the amount of land she cultivates and to increase the number of cattle she owns.  She dreams that her children will have good jobs and good families in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 2 bulls

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 32 года, замужем. У них с мужем трое замечательных детей. Бактыгул имеет среднее образование по характеру очень жизнерадостная и неунывающая позитивная женщина. С 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 9,000 KGS с приобретения 1 коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется очень развитое хозяйство. Ежемесячный доход от животноводства составляет 8,500 KGS.В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и 1 нетели.Тем самым она сможет увеличить свои доходы от молочной деятельности. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины и построить дом.
texts.en: Baktygul is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three wonderful children.  She has a higher education and, by character, is a lively and positive person.
