Since 2000, Baktygul has worked with livestock, having started her business with only one cow that she purchased for 9,000 KGS  Thanks to her care and perseverance, her business has continued to develop to this day.  She now brings in around 8,500 KGS monthly.  With the goal of further developing her business, Baktygul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS in order to buy one cow and one heifer. With this loan, she'll be able to increase her profits from the sale of dairy products.  Baktygul plans to use the addition profits from the loan to expand the number of animals among her livestock and to build a home.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one heifer

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоат 45 лет. Она с мужем и тремя детьми проживает в селе Чаркургон города Истаравшан. Шафоат честная, добрая и отзывчивая женщина. Она наравне с мужем трудится и обеспечивает семью. Вот уже несколько лет как Шафоат занимается животноводством. Она покупает коров и телят, откармливает и перепродает их. Сейчас Шафоат хочет расширить свою деятельность. С этой целью она запрашивает кредит для закупа крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Shafoat is 45 years old and she lives with her husband and three children in Istaravshan.  Shafoat is an honest, kind and sympathetic woman.  She works along with her husband to provide for their family and has been working with livestock for a few years.  She buys cows and calves, fattens them, and resells them.  Now she would like to expand her business.  With this goal in mind, Shafoat is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Yakutkhan

texts.ru: Якутхан 52 года, замужем, воспитывает двоих детей. Якутхан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве в 2001 году, использовав стартовый капитал в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в собственности Якутхан имеется 4 голов крупного рогатого скота, 5 овец и 12 домашних птиц. Якутхан обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения корма и 2 овец. Прибыль она планирует потратить на ремонт дома и хозяйственных построек.
texts.en: Yakutkhan is 52 years old, married, and is raising two children.  She started her business in livestock in 2001, with a sum of 15,000 KGS.  Today, she owns 4 head of cattle, 5 sheep and 12 fowls.  Yakutkhan has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy feed and two sheep.  She plans to use the increased profits from the loan to make repairs on her home and outbuildings.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and fodder

loans.name: Jailokoon

texts.ru: Жайлоокан, замужем, воспитывает пятерых детей. Жайлоокан начала свой заниматься откормом и реализацией скота 22 года назад, использовав стартовый капитал в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). В данное время у заемщицы имеется  20голов коров и 2 голов телят. Жайлоокан обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для приобретение 2 голов бычков. Прибыль она планирует потратить на ремонт дома и хозяйственных построек.
texts.en: Jailokoon is married and raising 5 children.  She started her own business fattening and selling cattle 22 years ago with 100,000 KGS.  Currently, she owns 20 cows and 2 calves.  Jailokoon has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy two bulls.  She plans to use the income generated by the loan to make repairs on her home and outbuildings.

loans.use: To purchase 2 bulls

loans.name: Askarboy

texts.ru: Аскарбой житель города Истаравшан. Ему 44 года. Он женат и имеет троих сыновей. Аскарбой трудолюбивый и предприимчивый человек. Он зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Аскарбой занят в сфере животноводства более 5 лет и является опытным скотоводом. В его деле, конечно, помогает ему семья. Аскарбой берет кредит для закупа скота с целью расширения бизнеса и улучшения финансового положения семьи.
texts.en: Askarboy is a resident of Istaravshan.  He's 44 years old, married and has three sons.  He is a hardworking and enterprising man and makes his living buying and selling cattle.  This has been Askarboy's profession for more than five years, he's now an experienced rancher.  Of course, his family helps him.  Askarboy is taking out a loan to buy cattle with the goal of expanding his business and improving his family's financial situation.

loans.use: To buy cattle with the goal of expanding his business and improving his family's financial situation.

loans.name: Anges

texts.en: Anges lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is 35 years old, married and has three children, ages 7, 9 and 12 years old. They are in school and all of them live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For a year now, she has been selling charcoal in her community. She got money from her oldest sister to start this business. Anges is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She would like to be a house owner in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her  business.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah is now 56 years old, still married to Simon, and raising their two children. She is still selling secondhand clothes as her primary business, and she started offering photocopying services as a secondary business. This increased her monthly income to 30,000 Kenyan shillings, which she has been using to support her family. Her business did well and she was able to repay the previous loan with much ease. She is grateful to KADET and Kiva for the financial support.

Keziah is applying for her second loan with KADET Ltd, which she will use to buy more clothes for selling. She anticipates profit from the business, which she will use to improve the living conditions of her family. Her dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru:
Улугбек живет со своей семьей в городе Истаравшан. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него маленькая дочь. Улугбек живет вместе с родителями, братьями и их семьей. У них очень большая семья. Улугбек честный, предприимчивый, деятельный человек. 
Улугбек занимается купле-продажей коров и телят. Он берет кредит для закупа крупно-рогатого скота. За счет полученной прибыли он хочет расширить бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение в семье.
texts.en: Ulugbek lives with his family in the city of Istaravshan.  He's 28 years old, married and has a young daughter.  He lives together with his parents, brothers, and his brothers' families--they have a large family.  Ulugbek is honest, enterprising and energetic.  He works buying and selling cows and calves and is taking out a loan to buy cattle.  With the profits from the loan, he wants to expand his business and improve his family's financial position.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Theophilous

texts.en: Theophilous is grateful for the loan he received from Milango. He used the first loan to repair the vehicle, which he later sold off. Theophilous is now applying for a loan of 83,500 KES to buy a three-wheeled vehicle. Because the funds are not enough, he wants to add this to the contribution with his other friends to purchase a three-wheeler in partnership. His ambition is to own a three-wheeler.

loans.use: to buy a three-wheeled vehicle.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a fish monger. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale. She also sells corn dough. Grace has been preparing these foods for the last four years now. She is married and has six children. She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe their children. Grace will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell in the market. She will expand her business with the new profits from her loan.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Konah

texts.en: Konah lives in West Point – one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is 35 years old, and she is single with three children, ages 10, 15, and 18. Her children are in school and live at home. For three years now, she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells charcoal retail by the bag. She received a little money as a loan from a community susu (a local saving account) to start her business. She learned the business from her mother. Konah likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal by the bag for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa produces kenkey (fermented maize dough) for sale in Asafora near Cape Coast. She is a widow and has four children. Adwoa has been selling kenkey for the past three years. As a single parent, she is responsible for the general upkeep of her children, and she uses her income for that. Whatever she has left, she saves for the future and reinvests in the business. Her loan will be used to buy maize for her dough and also to produce kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize for her dough and also to produce kenkey.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is 33 years old from Gaza. He is married and has three children. Bilal owns a shop for the maintenance and sale of used refrigerators and washing machines. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy new goods and build an attic for the shop. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy new goods and build an attic for the shop.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is a 37-year-old baker. She has three children, all of school-going age. She is an individual member of the group that meets on Fridays.
Joana has been doing her business for the past 6 years. She gets her goods from the market in bulk and, in turn, uses them to bake and sell goods to her customers. She is very dedicated, industrious, and very hardworking.
This is Joana’s fourth loan, and she is requesting 1,400 GHS to help her to buy more ingredients to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, margarine, and sugar to bake bread to sell to customers.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 29 years old. She lives in the small town of Rustavi with her family: her husband, her father-in-law and a child. Natia is the only income provider in the family. She works as an office manager and gets a small monthly salary. 

Natia requested credit for the start-up of a grocery business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with easy conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Natia will start to sell green grocery products. She will use the credit for purchasing fruit and vegetables from farmers at wholesale prices and sell them in her town with a price mark-up from a small store. 

She is confident that the requested loan will be productive for her business and beneficial for her family. Natia will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to start up a green grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy unit and to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Tomah

texts.en:
Tomah lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is 28 years old, and she is single with three children between 2 and 13 years old who are in school and live at home.

For the past six years, she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells soft drinks, cold water and toothpaste, soap, etc. She received a little amount from her boyfriend to start her business and learned it from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, cold water and toothpaste, soap, etc., for her  business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water and toothpaste, soap, etc., for her  business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them to sell. Efua has been selling smoked fish for four years now. She is married and has three children. She uses her income to support her husband to help feed and clothe their children. Efua will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. Efua will expand her business with the new profits from her loan.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 26 years old and single with two children who are in school. She lives at West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County that is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She is a high school graduate, and has been selling rooted fish and meat in her community for the past two years. She uses a motorbike to get her goods from the market since she does not live far from there. She really faces problems during the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fresh good fish and meat to expand her sales. She is proud of her business because it has gained her independence. Her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh good fish and meat to expand her sales.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 25-year-old woman who sells clothing. She is married to Kwabena, who is a 31-year-old businessman.

Hannah has been in this business for the past two years and is doing very well. She joined ID Ghana in July, 2011, through another beneficiary. She is a very dedicated individual. 

She has since taken three loans from ID. She is applying for her fourth loan and needs 1,400 GHS (Ghana cedis) to buy more clothes to sell to her customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jua Kali Group

texts.en:
Jentrix is a member of Jua Kali Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 12 One Acre Fund farmers, six women and six men. Jentrix is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Jentrix joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Jentrix joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer. 

Jentrix reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 10 bags of maize per 1 acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 19 bags per 1 acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to save for the future and buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Jentrix’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells locally made soap in Asafora near Cape Coast. She has been selling soap for 20 years now. Ama is married with five children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. Ama will use her loan to purchase raw materials to make her soap for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ama plans to continue to grow her business further.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make her soap for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ekonjero Group

texts.en:
Ekonjero is a group of 17 farmers in the Kakamega South District represented by James. The group has nine women and eight men. James is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. James joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. James joined One Acre Fund so that he could access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, James was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize per 0.75 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 9 bags per 0.75 acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, James’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purhcase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Estela Maribel

texts.es:
En una parroquia rural de la ciudad de Quito capital de la provincia del Ecuador, tras recorrer polvorientos caminos y respirar el aire puro del campo, se encuentra  Nanegalito, parroquia ubicada al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha, que fue residencia de una cultura ecuatoriana y que conserva recónditas historias del antepasado de la cultura ecuatoriana. Es un lugar poseedor de diversidad de flora y fauna y además ríos y cascadas que son una fuente cristalina que atrae turistas nacionales y extranjeros, por los negocios que ofertan deportes extremos que a simple vista se puede ver que son manufacturados con mucha seguridad e ingenio. Otro medio de producción de la zona es la ganadería con la producción de leche y carne y también la agricultura con la producción de caña de azúcar, yuca, caña, maíz, naranjas, mandarinas y papayas. Las artesanías elaboradas a mano también son una oportunidad de negocio en el lugar, que son demandadas por el uso particular de materiales naturales como semillas del bosque. Por todo esto las autoridades locales se han preocupado por hacer instalaciones adecuadas para que todos sus más de 3000 habitantes tengan acceso a los servicios básicos a pesar de que fue una zona que en el pasado no fue muy tomada en cuenta, pues hasta hace poco, muchos no gozaban el beneficio de tener agua potable o luz eléctrica. Aquí vive Estela, una mujer de 38 años que cada día se levanta con la esperanza de ver sus sueños hechos realidad, entre ellos el de ver a su hijo que actualmente tiene 19 años, convertido en un profesional de excelencia. Estela vive con su pareja Rafael de 44 años quien ha sido de gran apoyo. 
Estela desde hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado para producir leche y productos lácteos y cuando el caso lo amerita la venta de los animales. Trabaja hasta doce horas diarias cuidando, aseando y sacando la leche de las vacas. La ayuda de su pareja es muy importante para ella y ahora está solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprará una “vacona” que es el nombre que se les da a las vacas que están preñadas. Esto con el objetivo de producir tanto por medio de la vaca como también con su ternero. Estela se ha encontrado con varios obstáculos al querer obtener un capital, pues las garantías que ella ofrecía no eran suficientes, sin embargo, cuando se le pregunta a ella que es lo que la motivó a obtener el crédito con Fundación Alternativa, ella responde, que la convenció la agilidad y confianza que brindan además del apoyo al sector rural, que brinda a través del producto de Kiva con el cual además muchas personas alrededor del mundo le ayudarán a su crecimiento laboral.
texts.en:
In a rural parish in the city of Quito, Ecuador's capital, after following the dusty paths and breathing the country's pure air, we arrive at Nanegalito, a parish located to the northwest of Pichincha province.  This was the home of an Ecuadorean culture and it still holds some hidden stories of Ecuador's past.  This is a place with diverse flora and fauna, and clear rivers and waterfalls that attract both domestic and international visitors.  Businesses offer safe and exciting extreme sporting activities.  Another industry in the area is cattle raising, producing milk and meat, and agriculture, with sugar cane, yucca, reeds, oranges, mandarins and papayas grown here.  Handmade crafts are a also business opportunity here, with natural materials such as seed banks used to produce them.  With all this going on, local authorities worry about having the necessary facilities so that the more than 3000 inhabitants have access to basic services.  Despite this, this was a somewhat forgotten area in the past and until only recently many did not have access to running water or electricity.

Estela, 38 years old, lives here and every day she wakes up with the hope of seeing her dreams becoming a reality.  These dreams include seeing her son, now 19 years old, become a professional.  Estela lives with her partner, Rafael, who is 44 years old and who has been a big support.  For eight years Estela has been raising cattle in order to produce milk and other dairy products and, when it's worth it, selling the animals.  Estela works 12 hours a day, looking after, washing and milking the cows.  The help from her partner is very important for her and now she is applying for a loan to buy a pregnant cow.  She is doing this with the aim of producing products from both the cow and her calf.  Estela has come across various obstacles while looking for capital.  The guarantees she was offering were not enough but when she is asked what motivated her to seek a loan with Fundación Alternativa, she responds that she was convinced of the organisation's agility and their confidence in people.  In addition it supports the rural sector and, through Kiva, many people around the world are helping her in developing her career.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow to increase her income.

loans.name: Gpf Rewbé Golfe Bow Group

texts.fr:
Agée de 35 ans, madame Fatoumata est la présidente du groupe de crédit appelé Rewbe Golfe Bow qui se compose de 5 femmes qui habitent dans le même quartier et qui s’activent dans des activités génératrices de revenus. Cela fait 10 ans maintenant qu’elle vend des légumes. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour finir à 14h.
Grace au crédit, elle peut aider aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et améliorer son commerce en augmentant son stock.
Fatoumata veut réaliser un jour, un vieux rêve de jeunesse, celui d’ouvrir un salon de coiffure.
texts.en: 35-year-old Fatoumata is the leader of the loan group Rewbe Golfe Bow which is made up of 5 women who live in the same district and are engaged in revenue-generating activities. She has been selling vegetables for 10 years already. She starts her workday at 8 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 2 o'clock in the afternoon. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to help with the family's daily expenditures and improve her business by increasing her inventory. One day, Fatoumata would like to open a hair salon, a childhood dream of hers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Maria Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en el Barrio llamado Eduardo Contreras, su esposo labora  para una empresa privada al igual ella trabaja su mayor dificultad es que no pueden reunir de una sola verz el dinero para comprar los  materiales que necesitan para terminar su casa en construccion, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara Ceramica, Bondex,  Cemento y pinturas para hubicarla en el piso de su casa, Agradece  el Apoyo que Afodenic le esta brin dando en conjunto a Fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Mrs. María lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, Eduardo Contreras neighborhood. Her husband works for a private company. She works also, but it is difficult for them to collect the money to buy the materials needed to finish building their house.

With the granted loan she will buy tiles, tile mortar, cement and paints for the floor. She appreciates the help that AFODENIC and KIVA have given her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Houleymatou

texts.fr:
Madame Houleymatou est une dame de 50 ans qui s’active dans le commerce et qui a acquis une expérience de 15 ans. Elle est  mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’ainé a 30 ans et le dernier, 13 ans. La dame Houleymatou s’active dans la vente de tissus et de draps. Il faut dire qu’avec la conjoncture d’aujourd’hui il est rare d’embraser un métier par vocation, c’est le cas de la dame qui pratique le commerce afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille.
Pour diversifier l’activité, elle a comme souhait d’acheter une ferme et d’y cultiver.
texts.en: Houleymatou is a 50-year-old woman who works in retail and has built up 15 years' worth of experience. She is married and the mother of 5 children, the eldest of whom is 30 years old and the youngest, 13. Houleymatou sells fabrics and bedsheets. It must be said that in current times, it is rare for someone to embark on a vocational career; this is the case for this lady, who is working in retail so that she can meet her needs and those of her family. In order to diversify her activities, she would like to buy a farm and grow crops.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and bedsheets for resale.

loans.name: Marièta

texts.fr:
Madame Marièta âgée de 39 ans est vendeuse de couscous depuis 2 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille de 4 enfants : son ainé est âgé de 20 ans. Elle commence sa journée à 10h pour finir à 14h de l’après –midi. Elle possède sa clientèle dans le quartier et vend chez elle.
Elle appuie son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Elle veut augmenter son stock de marchandises et pour cela, veut travailler avec l’IMCEC pour atteindre son objectif.
texts.en: Marièta is 39 years old and has been selling couscous for 2 years. She is married and the mother of 4 children. Her eldest child is 20 years old. She starts her workday at 10 o'clock in the morning and finishes it at 2 o'clock in the afternoon. Her customers live in her district and she sells from her home. She supports her husband with the management of the daily expenditures. She would like to increase her inventory of merchandise and, in order to do so, would like to work with UIMCEC so that she can achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy millet and corn with which to make couscous.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Âgée de 50ans, Ama a pour époux un mécanicien et ont ensemble 3 enfants. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle fait le commerce des oignons et des légumes qu’elle achète à Lomé et revend dans un marché de la place. Avec une ancienneté de 24ans dans cette activité, elle sollicite un troisième crédit à WAGES pour l’achat de marchandises. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité tout en assurant un avenir radieux à la famille.
texts.en: 50-year-old Ama is married to a mechanic and the couple have 3 children together. In order to help her spouse with the household expenses, she sells onions and vegetables that she buy in Lomé and sells at a local market. With 24 years of service in this business, she is requesting a 3rd loan from WAGES with which to buy merchandise. Her future plans include reinvesting in her business whilst also ensuring a bright future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 28ans, mr koami a pour femme une revendeuse et ils ont 01 enfant de 02ans en charge. Koami quant à lui est revendeur de chaussures dans un marché de la place depuis 2000. Pour mieux satisfaire ses nombreux clients, il fait son troisième crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Son souhait est de rendre pérenne son activité tout en assurant un meilleur avenir à sa famille.
texts.en: A young, 28-year-old man, Koami is married to a reseller and the couple are raising one 2-year-old child. Koami has been a shoe-seller at a local market since 2000. He is requesting his 3rd loan from WAGES so that he can buy merchandise and better satisfy his numerous customers. His wish is to make his business sustainable whilst also ensuring a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Adjoua

texts.fr: Adjowa est mariée  à un retraité. Ils ont 04 enfants dont 03 sur les bancs d’école. L’ainé est âgé de 22ans et le dernier 11ans. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle fait le commerce d’objets plastiques et de chaussures à domicile.  Afin de répondre plus aux besoins des clients, elle fait un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises (chaussures et objets plastiques). Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille et agrandir son activité. Notons qu’il est dans ce domaine il ya 10ans.
texts.en: Adjowa is married to a pensioner. The couple have 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. The eldest is 22 years old and the youngest, 11. In order to support her husband with the household expenses, Adjowa sells plastic items and shoes door-to-door. She is requesting a 2nd loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandise (shoes and plastic articles) so that she can better respond to her customers' needs. In the future, she plans to provide for her family's basic needs and increase her business. She has been in her line of work for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy plastic items and shoes.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.fr: Agé de 57 ans, monsieur Idrissa fait du commerce de produits divers depuis 6 ans. Idrissa s’étant marié un peu tard, il a de jeunes enfants, son ainé étant âgé de 4 ans seulement. Il fait de la vente de produits alimentaires  divers. Il est à sa première expérience de crédit et aimerait  s’approvisionner en denrées comme de l’huile de palme, du café… Il pourra améliorer  son stock de marchandises. Si son fond de roulement augmente, il aimerait  ouvrir une boutique de vente de produits divers.
texts.en: 57-year-old Idrissa has been selling assorted items for 6 years. Having gotten married at quite a late stage in his life, he has young children, his eldest child being only 4 years old. He sells various food items. This is his first experience with credit and he would like to purchase some food items like palm oil and coffee. He would be able to improve his inventory of merchandise. If his business increases, he would like to open a shop selling miscellaneous items.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as palm oil and coffee.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 24 years old from Gaza.  He is married and has 3 children.
He has owned a grocery and vegetable stall since 2012.
He has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a small automobile to cut the cost of transportation.
He hopes that this loan will help him increase his income and improve his life.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile to use for transporting goods to his food stall.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 25 years old from Gaza. He has owned a grocery store since 2009.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator and some goods.
He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income, allowing him to be able to get married and have his own family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and some goods for his grocery store.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has 2 children and has been farming for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is picking tea! Her biggest challenge is waiting at the tea buying center. One of the animals at her farm is named Nyamwamu.

Everline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that she has had a previous loan with Juhudi. She feels it is a perfect fit for her.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and she answered that the way you pay the first loan back will determine the subsequent loans you are able to receive.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how will this loan benefit your family, Everline replied that it will be easier to pay school fees.
As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Everline owns the following a cow, and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with two children, one of which goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a food stall. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal, bunches of green bananas, onions, eggplants and tomatoes. She has had her food stall for four years. She works at the market six days out of every week selling to a variety of people. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler, start growing some vegetables like cabbages and tomatoes and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal, bunches of green bananas, onions,eggplants and tomatoes for her food stall.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Ophelia live in West Point, Montserrado County which is noted for the most commercial city in Liberia. She is 34 years old, and has two children aged 5 and 19 years old. For the past 16 years she has been selling rice, palm oil, soap, salt, vita, etc. in the local market on a table. One of the problems she faces is limited capital. She enjoys the profit she makes every day and having money for her expenses. She is proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, soap, salt, vita, etc. for her business. In the near future she would to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, soap, salt, vita, etc. for her food market.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County.  She is 38 years old, and has 5 children. For the past three years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market.  One of the problems she faces is that the prices are too high. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes daily and having money in her home.  Her restaurant makes her proud. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, meat, pigs feet and chicken feet for her business. Her dream is to become a successful business woman and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, meat, pigs feet and chicken feet for her restaurant.

loans.name: Vanisha's Group

texts.en:
Vanisha's group is comprised of 5 hard working women. Vanisha is 20 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Vanisha has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells tablets.

To help expand her business, Vanisha has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more drugs for sell, and will help Vanisha to generate greater profits and expand her business up to the wholesale level. Vanisha hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a house.

Vanisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more medicines.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en: Merab is 37 years old and lives in the small town of Kobuleti with his family, his wife, 7-year-old child and retired mother. The source of income for the family is the monthly pension of Merab’s mother. Merab has requested a loan from local financial institutions several time but his loan requests were always rejected because of low income and lack of experience in the new business. His current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Merab owns a car and plans to serve the locals as a taxi driver but he will have to charge higher prices for his service because of the benzene (fuel) price is high. Not many citizens can afford to use the taxi service at a higher price. Because of the above mentioned problem, Merab has decided to change his taxi's fuel system from benzene to gas, which is cheaper than benzene and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 per cent. It will allow Merab to decrease the price of the service, which will attract more customers. Increasing the number of customers and cutting his costs will positively affect his profit. He will pay a local auto service center to change the fuel system. The increased income will be used for the family’s well being.

loans.use: to change the fuel system in his car to have it run more cost effectively.

loans.name: Eliana Maribel

texts.es:
Eliana es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Eliana no ha podido culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero sueña con poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Tallarines Verdes para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eliana trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto relazando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Eliana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de la compra de materiales y mano de obra, ya que desea terminar la construcción de la vivienda de sus padres, de esta manera ella podrá brindarles mayor bienestar y seguridad a su familia, así pues Eliana seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eliana is a 21 year old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings. She is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who really wants to get ahead. Lamentably, due to a lack of financial resources and because she needed to work and help her parents, Eliana hasn't been able to finish secondary school. She dreams of doing it, however. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and at times, she cooks delicious tallarines verdes to share with her family. 

On her own intiative, and witth much effort and dedication, Eliana works as a laborer on a farm in her city. She works every day starting early in the morning and can work for around 8 hours. She is content doing her work and thinks that it going well for her because of her hard work and friendly treatment of others. 

Eliana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given she will be able to cover the expenses of buying materials and paying labor costs, because she wants to finish construction on her parents' house. This way, she can offer better well being and safety to her family. Eliana will keep working and striving to achieve her big dream of going to college and getting ahead.

loans.use: to do construction on her home.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El señor Jose habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su familia quien le apoya en todas las decisiones que toma ya el busca siempre la  mejora para el hogar, su esposa le ayuda con los gastos de la casa ya que es comerciante, el sueña con terminar su casa pero se le ha hecho un poco dificil ya el con el trabjo de taxista no gana  mucho y su mayor dificultad es que no pueden recaudar una sola vez el dinero para la compra de materiales. con este credito comprara lo siguiente: Cemento, Arena, Zinc, Perlines, Puertas, Ceramica. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindo estos años y la confianza de Fondos Kiva.
texts.en: Jose lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his family, who support him in all of the decisions he makes, since he is always trying to improve the home. His wife helps him with the household expenses because she is a merchant. His dream is to finish building his house but it has become a little difficult since he works as a taxi driver and doesn't make a lot. His biggest difficulty is that he can't raise all of the money he needs to buy materials at once. With this loan, he will buy the following: cement, sand, zinc, rods, doors, and ceramic tiles. he is grateful for the support that Afodenic has given him and for the trust of Fondos Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 45 años de edad ,casada y con  3 hijos reside en una casa diseñada de madera la cual es fruto de su esfuerzo . Teodosia tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado principal de la ciudad ,en donde vende productos regionales como plátanos, limones, hojas de “bijao” (usados para preparar algunos alimentos), yuca, cocona, carbones y otros. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 10 años y sus ganancias económicas le están sirviendo para educar y criar a sus hijos, siempre trabajó sola y lo hace así hasta ahora.Le va bien en su actividad ya que siempre se entrega al máximo para poder tener sus ingresos de manera sostenible ya que por el esfuerzo que le demanda tiene que trabajar buscando siempre su comodidad.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible este crédito para asi continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas . Con el monto solicitado comprará diversos productos regionales como plátano, yuca, limones, cocona y otros porductos en el mercado mayorista  para asi continuar vendiendo en su puesto del mercado.
texts.en: Teodosia is 45 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She lives in a house made of wood which is the fruit of her labors. Teodosia has a booth in the main market in the city where she sells regional products such as plantains, lemons, "bijao" leaves (used to make some foods), yucca, cocona fruit, charcoal and more. She has been doing this work for 10 years and her earnings are being used to educate and raise her children. She always has worked alone and has done so so far. It is going well for her in her activity because she always works as hard as she can to have sustainable income, because the demand she has requires her to work all the time. At this time, she is asking for S/. 600. She is grateful to all of the people who have made this loan possible so that she can continue doing her job with better results. On the other hand, she is committed again to making her payments on time. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy different regional products such as plantain, yucca, lemons, cocona fruit and other products in the wholesale market so she can continue to sell in her market stall.

loans.use: to buy regional fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Angela Ramona

texts.es:
Ángela  es una mujer de 29 años, creció en una familia de escasos recursos económicos lo que ocasionó que ella no pudiera seguir con sus estudios después de terminar la primaria. Es soltera y para ella ha sido un reto muy difícil el educar a su hijo sola, pero con el tiempo ha aprendido mucho de esta experiencia y ahora su hijo está estudiando en una escuela fiscal y Ángela sueña con verlo convertido en un profesional. Vive con su pequeño hijo en la Parroquia de Río Verde, un lugar histórico de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Ángela lleva al sustento a su hogar y cubre los gastos de servicios básicos, educación y demás, gracias al negocio que emprendió hace 2 años con la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante; ella recorre las largas calles de su ciudad tomando los pedidos de sus clientes que en la mayoría son mujeres. Trabaja las mañanas y en la tarde permanece en su hogar para ayudar a su hijo con las tareas y terminar los quehaceres domésticos. Sin embargo también los fines de semana acompañada de su hijo acude a los domicilios de sus clientes para realizar labor de cobranzas. Ángela desea crecer con su negocio sin dejar desatendido su hogar, para lo cual ha requerido un préstamo para adecuar un espacio de su casa como un local de atención a clientes que requieran los productos que ella mantiene en stock y así ella no pierda ventas en las horas de la tarde que permanece con su hijo. Ángela agradece a Fundación Alternativa quienes le brindaron confianza y asesoría para dar este paso de crecimiento y además motiva a las personas alrededor del mundo que aportan con personas como ella para que continúen realizando estos préstamos que tanto beneficio traen.
texts.en:
Ángela is a 29 year old woman. She grew up in a family with few economic resources. As a result it was not possible for her to continue studying after finishing primary school. She is a single mother. It has been a struggle to provide an education to her child all by herself, but over time she has learned a lot from this experience and her child is now is studying at a public elementary school. Ángela’s dream is that her child will become a professional. 

She lives with her young child in the parish of Río Verde, a place full of history. The parish is located in Santo Domingo, the capital of the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province in Ecuador, which has sustained high growth over the past number of years. The most attractive and interesting feature of Santo Domingo city is its delicious fruit and the local gastronomy. The level of business carried out here is also considerable as it has become an inland hub for commercial activity between the country’s mountain and coastal regions. Furthermore, its many tourist attractions and warm climate make it a popular destination for domestic and foreign tourists. For this reason, most of the city’s inhabitants are involved in some form of commercial activity or service for local residents and tourists.

Ángela maintains her family, paying the service bills for all their basic needs, such as education, etc. She does this thanks to the business she set up 2 years ago selling cosmetics door to door. She travels the long city streets taking orders from her customers who are mostly women. She works in the morning. In the afternoon she stays at home to help with homework and to do the household chores. But she works at weekends too when she goes, with her child, to her customers’ homes to collect the payments she is owed. 

Ángela wants to grow her business but still attend to her home. For this reason she has requested a loan. She will use this money to renovate a space in her house to serve customers who wish to buy the products she has in stock. In this way she will not lose potential sales when she is at home in the afternoon with her child. Ángela is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa who have advised her and placed their confidence in her.  This has enabled her to take the first step to growing her business. It also motivates people around the world to support those such as Ángela and to continue giving loans which are so beneficial.

loans.use: to create a business space within her home where she can sell her products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her business.  Little by little she has increased her sales since she herself goes out to offer her products in the zone. 

She sells mostly clothing for women and children, like blouses, shorts, undergarments, t-shirts and sweatshirts.  One of her great dreams is to have her own store in the city center.  She is asking for a loan to purchase seasonal clothing.  This will help her greatly with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married with two children and one of her children goes to school.  She takes care of additional family members (mother and son-in-law).  She has a poultry farming business.  She has been in this business for two years and works from her home seven days a week.  

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed.  Her major business challenges include   poultry diseases and seasonality.  She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.  She is aspiring to own 2,000 laying birds and 1,000 broilers.   She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana-growing region. She has three children and has been doing this work for 10 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Dairy farming and picking tea!' Her biggest challenge is 'Poultry.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyamotika.'

Lilian was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'The interest rate is fair.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to use the loan facility.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Lilian replied 'my income will improve hence better living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lilian owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, sewing machine' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Salo's Group

texts.en:
Salomey and Theresa are the members in this group. They sell provisions and plantains respectively. They have been together from 2010 to date. 

Salomey is a 61-year-old widow who is living with a grandchild. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two and a half years and is doing very well with her business. 

She has been doing this business for five years now. She works from Mondays through to Saturdays. Without ID Ghana’s training on savings, she would not have made it this far. This is her 4th loan and she needs GHS 1,500 to buy more merchandise to sell to her customers. 

Both need a total amount of GHS 2,300 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy provisions (milk, Milo, sugar, rice, canned beef and other canned products)

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 26-year-old single young man.  His father is a worker with a very low income that barely cover the family needs.  

Tamer is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop.  This will help Tamer to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies.  This will ensure a better future for Tamer and improve the family's living conditions.  Tamer is photographed at the store where he purchases the laptop.

loans.use: to pay the costs of a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is a 20-year-old single young man.  His father is a worker with a very low income that barely cover the family needs. 

Akram is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop.  This will help Akram to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies.  This will ensure a better future for Tamer and improve the family's living conditions.  Akram is photographed at the store where he purchases the laptop.

loans.use: to pay the costs of buying a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
She has a very good business that buys and sells chickens.  She sells them to restaurants, diners and other entities; and thanks to the quality of her product, she is making headway.

Mary struggles to get ahead and help her family through her work.  Her goal is to own a shop one day, and be able to attend to customers there.  She is requesting a loan to buy chickens, to keep up her supply and stay in business.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 28 is living in a Roma minority community.  He is married and has one child, 7 years old.  His wife is a housewife, taking care of the household needs. To earn a living, Ali works as a façades in his area.  His job is the family’s main source of income, but he does not earn enough to provide all the needs of his family.

Currently they live in a house which is in need of renovation.  Due to the high cost of electricity, they want to façade their house in order to save costs on heating in the winter.  Ali is requesting a loan to buy a new door, windows for the renovating and to façade the house. This loan will help Ali and his family to improve their living conditions. 

His goal is to renovate his house and he hopes to offer his children a better life!   Ali and his family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy a new door, windows for the renovating and to façade the house.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado County.  She lives with her three children, who are in school, and are ages 6, 9 and 12.  

Teta is a high school graduate and for the past two years she has been selling rice, pepper, soap, charcoal, onion, vita in her community.  She enjoys her business because she makes more profits every day since she has more customers.  She started this business by selling food (fixing and selling local soup) from a wheel barrow.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, soap, charcoal, onion, vita  for her business.  Her plan is to build a house and send her children to college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, soap, charcoal, onion, vita  for her business,

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.es: Gulnara de 50 años de edad es soltera y tiene 2 hijos , ella cuenta con una casa propia la cual es fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación. El trabajo de Gulnara se inicia muy temprano, a diario sale al taller que comparte con su hermana siendo ambas socias del negocio. Se dedica a confeccionar y refaccionar diferentes prendas de vestir ya sea de damas, caballeros y niños. Plasma en cada uno de las prendas que realiza lo mejor de su creatividad poniendo mucho empeño en la ejecución de los detalles, la cual se ve reflejada en  la satisfacción que muestran los clientes al recibir una prenda de calidad. Lleva en este negocio mas de 5 años, en ocasiones trabaja en su casa en donde también tiene una modesta maquina de coser y todos los materiales necesarios para cumplir su labor.Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que labora al lado de su hermana quien le ayuda a ser mejor cada día tanto laboral como emocionalmente, además, asegura que sus clientes son selectos y esto le permite tener buenos ingresos  , espera seguir progresando en esta actividad , ya que tiene muchas expectativas a futuro.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 300 soles y a su vez se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará colgadores de ropa, hilos de colores, agujas y algunas telas especiales para confeccionar vestidos y blusas.
texts.en: Gulnara is 50 years old, single and has two children.  Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she owns her own house.  Gulnara starts work very early and goes out every day to the workshop that she shares with her sister, who is also her business partner.  She makes a living repairing and making different clothes for men, women and children.  Each of Gulnara's clothing items captures the best of her creativity and a lot of effort goes into the detail on the clothing, something which is reflected in customers when they are satisfied with quality clothes.  Gulnara has had the business for more than five years.  She sometimes works at home where she has a modest sewing machine and all the materials she requires to work.  What she likes about her job is that she works alongside her sister who helps her to become better, both at work and emotionally, every day.  She has exclusive customers allowing a good income.  Gulnara hopes to continue progress in this work as she has many expectations for the future.  She is now applying for 300 Nuevo Soles and promises to make her repayments on time.  With the loan she will buy coat hangers, coloured threads, needles and some special materials for making dresses and blouses.

loans.use: to buy threads, coat hangers, needles and materials.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in West Point, one of the most populated and best-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 43 years old, married and has ten children between the ages of 19 and 29 years old; only one lives at home and attends school. 

For 8 years now she has been running a shop where she sells cold water, soft drinks, and charcoal. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season since she doesn’t have a good location.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes. Having  food in her home makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, and charcoal for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, and charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and spices to prepare cake and sell to customers

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa lives in West Point, one of the most populated and best-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is married with two children, 13 and 20 years old, who live at home and attend school. 

For four years now she has been selling rice, oil, peppers and other items in her community. Too little income is the problem she faces now.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, peppers and other items for her business, Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers and others items for her business

loans.name: Rina

texts.es: Rina tiene 39 años y es madre soltera de una niña de 14 años, actualmente vive en casa de su madre.La actividad que realiza Rina es el servicio de cosmetología y peluquería. Atiende a diversos clientes que requieren de algún arreglo estético como corte de cabello, tintes, coloraciones, maquillaje y otros. Además, vende productos de belleza femeninos como, esmaltes, labiales, perfumes y otros. En su cartera de clientes estan sus amigos y otras personas que acuden a ella por recomendación.  Brinda siempre un trato amable y cordial, cualidad que le ha servido para que siempre tenga buenos clientes. Se inició en esta actividad hace 1 año y hasta el momento lo realiza sola , considera a su negocio bastante rentable ya que obtiene buenas ganancias razon por la cual se siente una empresaria próspera e independiente. Espera continuar su negocio y poco a poco implementar un espacio en su hogar para que asi pueda atender con mayor comodidad a su clientela .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles que le serviran para comprar artículos de belleza tales como tintes capilares, cremas, peines, ganchos, entre otros , a su vez se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas ..
texts.en: Rina is 39 years old and a single mother to her 14 year old daughter.  She is currently living at her mother's house.  Rina's work is hairdressing and beauty therapy.  She serves various customers who are in need of beauty treatments, such as a hair cut, hair dying, highlights, make-up and other services.  In addition she sells beauty products for women, such as nail varnish, lipstick, perfume and other items.  She has friends and other people who come to her business on recommendation.  Rina always provides friendly and polite service and these qualities have always helped her to have good customers.  She started this work a year ago and, for now, she works alone.  She thinks her business is quite profitable as she makes a good lving.  For this reason she feels prosperous and independent.  She hopes to continue with her business and, little by little, to have a space in her home so she can tend to her customers more comfortably.  On this occasion she is applying for a loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles that will help her to buy beauty products such as hair dye, creams, combs, hairpins and other items.  She promises to be punctual with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Dorian Heysil

texts.es:
Dorian tiene 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir como son faldas, blusas, vestidos, pantalones, arreglo de prendas de vestir (remiendos).  Esta actividad la realiza con el apoyo de una prima que también es modista, ellas trabajaban en un taller de confección pero el dueño por diferentes motivos cerro la empresa y ellas decidieron poner su propio taller,  esta actividad la aprendió de sus familiares que también se dedicaban ha esta actividad cuenta con 20 años de experiencia. Y la realiza en su casa de habitación, se puede mencionar que la costura es le alta calidad. 

Ella tiene contratos con diferentes centros educativos de la zona donde les elabora dos uniformes por año,le llevan todas las telas para la confección de los uniformen, ella solo compra: hilo, botones, zíperes, semis dure para las blusas, etc.  Estos accesorios los compra en tiendas que se encuentran ubicadas en la ciudad que están a una distancia de 1 kilómetro de su casa.      

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos maquinas industriales (nuevas). La principal necesidad que se podrá satisfacer con el otorgamiento del crédito es la compra de dos maquines industriales debido a que las que tiene son planas y no tienen la suficiente capacidad que ella requiere. Ademas,  podrá tener mas tiempo para la confección de mas prendas de vestir con la compra de dos maquinas que si cumplan con la necesidad que ella tiene en éste momento. 

Dorian, tiene planes a futuro de comenzar con la construcción de su casa; por que desde siempre a vivido alquilando y ella ya quiere tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Dorian is 38 years old and has two children.  She works making clothes such as skirts, blouses, dresses, and pants.  She also fixes clothing (using patches).  She does this work with the support of her cousin, who is also a dressmaker.  They used to work for a business, but the owner, for different reasons, closed the company and they decided to start their own business.  They learned this trade from relatives who also work in this trade and have 20 years of experience.  She works from her house and it can be said that her sewing is of high quality.

She has agreements with different schools in the area, where she makes them two uniforms per year.  They bring her all the fabric to make the uniforms and she only buys thread, buttons, zippers, plastic decorations for the blouses, etc.  She buys these accessories in stores that are located in the city that is 1 kilometer from her house.

The loan that she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy two new industrial sewing machines.  The main need that she will be able to satisfy with the granting of the loan is to buy two machines, since the ones she has aren't level and don't have the capacity that she requires.  In addition, she will be able to have more time to make more clothing once she buys two machines, if they fulfill her current needs.

Dorian has plans to begin construction on her house in the future.  She has always lived in rented housing and she wants to have her own house.

loans.use: buy two industrial sewing machines.

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Pablo, agricultor desde hace muchos años, su familia  lo apoya en todo momento y en todas sus decisiones, gracias al apoyo de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva a sacado adelante sus siembros de Cafe y su economia  ha mejorado un poco en la actualidad requiere de capital para darle un optimo mantenimiento a sus cultivos, con este nuevo credito comprara los insumos necesarios como: Urea, Completo, Fertilizante etc.
texts.en:
Pablo has been a farmer for many years.  His family supports him at all times and in all of his decisions.  Thanks to the help of AFODENIC and Kiva Funds he has moved forward with sowing his coffee and his finances have improved a little.

Currently he needs capital to give his crops optimal care.  With this new loan he'll buy the necessary supplies, such as urea, Completo [fertilizer], fertilizer, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies to care for his crops

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She operates a tailoring shop and has been in business for the past ten years. She used her previous loan to buy fabric. Her business flourished and she repaid her loan. She is very hard working. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to buy more fabric for making more clothes.

She hopes to educate her children and to also expand her business. 

She requires a loan of 32,298 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Iza

texts.en:
Iza is from the small town of Borjomi. She is 39 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two sons (12 and 16 years old). Iza’s husband is a contractor soldier and gets a monthly salary. According to government estimations, the family belongs to the 'vulnerable poor' category and gets a small monthly social assistance. The income is hardly enough to cover even food and everyday expenses for the family. 

Iza requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting a trading business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the lack of experience in her job, which is usually demanded by the local credit providers. 

Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the requested loan, Iza will purchase kitchen utensils and different kinds of household items in capital city open market for wholesale prices and resell them in her town for a profit. It will be hard work for Iza, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils for starting a trading business.

loans.name: Liset Magali

texts.es: La Sra. Liset tiene 28 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 1 y 5 años, ella se dedica al servicio de todo tipo de impresiones, en su imprenta que se encuentra ubicado en la zona 16 de Julio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Liset va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de una impresora de imprenta para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere actualizar su equipo de trabajo para la impresión de buena calidad  que por la falta de efectivo no la podía comprar y el préstamo le hacía mucha falta, La Sra. Liset enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen muchas imprentas por la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando equipos y materiales que necesita y su deseo es tener un estudio fotográfico con todos los equipos modernos para brindar a su clientela un servicio de calidad.
texts.en:
Liset, 28, has two children, ages 1 and 5.  She makes a living doing all kinds of printing in her print shop located in the 16 de Julio area.

This loan is her first sequence with the institution.  Liset is going to use this loan to buy a printer for her business.  She requesting the loan because she wants to update her work equipment to have good-quality printing.  She needs it a lot but wasn't able to buy it because she didn't have the cash.

The challenge Liset faces in her business is competition, because there are many print shops in the area.  She's going to use the profits to continue buying equipment and materials she needs.

Her desire is to have a photography studio with all the modern equipment to give her customers quality service.

loans.use: to buy a printer

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally  is married with four children and all her children go to school.   She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for six years, selling to all categories of people, retail. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

 Sally generates additional income from selling Irish potatoes and dry cleaning at her home six days a week.  Her major business challenge includes ever increasing prices of used clothes and seasonality. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent. She doen't use machines for  washing but instead uses her own hands and liquid soap for dry cleaning

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Akuguzibwe

texts.en:
Akuguzibwe is 32 years old, married, with five children who are all school-going. She operates a retail shop in Kagadi town which she started in order to supplement the income of her husband, so that they can ably meet their family's necessities. Her business is operated in a rented room and she primarily sells soft drinks, maize flour, and rice, among other items.

Akuguzibwe wants a loan of UGX 800,000/= (eight hundred thousand shillings) to pay school fees for her children since the husband cannot raise the fees, alone, from his business. 

Akuguzibwe's dream is to educate their children up to higher levels of learning. However, her challenge is the limited capital in the business and the difficulty of generating enough money to pay school fees and grow the business at the same time. She would like the lender to always help her with the financial support to achieve her dreams. 

In the photo Akuguzibwe is with the UGAFODE Microfinance Limited staff.

loans.use: To pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Mrembo Group

texts.en:
Dunstone is a member of Mrembo Group in Kakamega South District. He is pictured as one of eleven One Acre Fund farmers, nine women and two men. Dunstone is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Dunstone first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Dunstone joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices.

Dunstone reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about two bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 6 1/2 bags per 1/2 acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and buy a pig. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Dunstone’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 1/2 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Oruj

texts.en:
Oruj is 48 years old. He lives in the small village of Lagodekhi District. Oruj has a large family: his wife, two sons, daughter-in-law, mother-in-law, and two grandchildren. Oruj requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a greenhouse where cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. They sell the harvested products seasonally. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Oruj requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Oruj will use his loan to start a car wash. He will purchase the essential equipment and a vacuum cleaner. Oruj will provide services to his local community members and hopes to increase the monthly income of the family. A little part of the loan will also be used for purchasing the seeds to sow in his greenhouse. 

His new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed to start a car wash.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie lives in West Point, Montserrado County, which is noted for being the most commercial city in Liberia. She is 47 years old and has seven children between 10 and 31 years old. Only three of her children are in school and two live at home. 

For a year now, she has been selling cold soft drinks and cold water in the local market. One of the problems she faces is small capital. She enjoys the profit she makes every day, and having money for her expenses makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold soft drinks and cold water for her business.

Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cold soft drinks and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a single mother with one child and her only child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling beef stew. She has applied for a loan  of 300000/= Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more beef, garlic salt and other spices.  She works at the market and sells to all categories of people but at a retail basis and works six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to start a bakery and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more beef, garlic and other spices for roasting beef.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy windows for his house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 49 years old and lives in the town of West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She lives with her husband, who has his own business. They have three children between 17 and 23 years old. Two of them are in school and the oldest one is out of school. 

For six years Beatrice has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. Sometimes she does not have enough money to buy more stock since the prices are not stable and getting much more expensive every day. She likes to talk with her customers and learned how to cook from her mother a long time ago. 

Beatrice has requested a loan to buy more fish, bush meat, rice, pepper, charcoal, oil, vita, bowls and cups to increase her customer traffic. In the future she would like to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish, bush meat, rice, pepper, charcoal, oil, vita, bowls and cups to increase her customer traffic.

loans.name: Sang'alo D Group

texts.en:
The Sang'alo D Group has 10 farmers, one man and nine women, and is located in Bungoma South District. Colleta is the featured borrower, and is pictured on the right of Sang'alo D Group with her hand raised. 

She is asking for a loan capable of planting a ½  acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Colleta joined One Acre Fund during the long rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the long rains 2013 season. Colleta joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and access the best prices. 

Colleta reports that before the One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about two bags of maize per acre, but with her One Acre Fund loan during long rains 2012, she harvested eight bags per 1/2 acre!
