Colleta described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to improve her living standard by being able to afford basic needs, and to buy a cow. 

During the 2013 long rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Colleta’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as focused and determined. 

She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens and eggs. In addition, Grace has rental houses from which she gets income.

Her business is located within a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her family. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is married and has two children who both go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees. 

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for four years. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenge includes thieves who steal charcoal at night and seasonality.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She aspires to sell charcoal at her home, to educate her children up to university and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Crecyl Jane

texts.en:
A married mother of two, 25-year-old Crecyl Jane lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. For over four years, she has owned and operated a tricycle transportation service, earning about 4,000 PHP per month.

Crecyl Jane, who joined GDMPC in 2009, is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires for her tricycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase another tricycle.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle tires and spare parts.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a petty trader at Soba, Hohoe. She has never been to school. She is single and has two children. Over the past years she has helped support herself and her extended family members. She is responsible for paying the school fees of her younger siblings. 

Elizabeth has been in the petty trading business since 2008. Her loan will be used to buy tins of Milo, milk, biscuits and other provisions. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to enable her and her business to build a better future.

loans.use: to buy tins of Milo, milk, biscuits and other provisions.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old and lives in the town of West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county; She lives with her partner, who has his own business, and they have four children age 3 months to 15 years old. They live at home with her and three attend school.
 
For three years now Alice has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. She likes the interaction with her customers and learned how to cook from her mother a long time ago. 

Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy her ingredients wholesale and has to buy retail, which is much more expensive. Alice has requested a loan to buy oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business. In the future she would like to own a car.

loans.use: to buy oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Beckey's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, Rebecca and Hasia, who sell jewelry and clothes respectively in the Dansoman community. They have been a group since 2011.

Rebecca, a 38-year-old single parent of one child, has been selling jewelry for the past three years. She works from Monday to Saturday from her home or hawks to her customers. This enterprise has enabled her to educate her child. She is now requesting her third loan for GHS 1,000 to buy more jewelry to sell.

In total, the group needs GHS 1,700 to buy more goods for their respective businesses.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry and supply to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Mila is married and has six children. 

To make a living, Mila owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of different products, such as canned goods, vegetables and soy sauce, in the local community. Mila has been in her business for 12 years and earns 8,000PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Mila joined GDMPC. Mila is requesting a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to have a comfortable house.

loans.use: purchase more items, such as canned goods, vegetables and soy sauce

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 50 years old. She is married with four children and she is from Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Analiza owns farmland and operates a farm, harvesting and planting corn to sell in order to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns 12,000 PHP per month. 

In 2011, Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Analiza is requesting a loan amount of 22,000 PHP for the purpose of purchasing fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to expand her corn production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old. She is married with five children and she is from Molicay, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Anita owns farmland and operates a farm, harvesting and planting rice to sell in order to earn. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Anita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to buy farm equipment.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Evonnie

texts.en:
Evonnie is 37 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She was unable to attend school, but she says she is good at managing her business. 

She is married and has four children between 3 to 13 years old, all of them are in school and live at home. For the past six years, she has been selling  soft drinks in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. She hopes to improve her business and send her children to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business,

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 50 years old and widowed with four children. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. 

For over five years, she has been doing manicures and pedicures for her clients in the local community. She earns 3,000 PHP per month. 

Amelita joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan amount of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional beauty equipment/tools for her services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to have her own salon.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty equipment/tools for her services

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia vive en Curicó, Chile donde vende pan, queques y cremas de piel. Las cremas son para ambos cara y cuerpo y 100% naturales que se compra desde Temuco y las vende en Curicó y Santiago. Se va a usar su préstamo para compra  cremas, dejar un poco ahorrado y comprar insumos para hacer pan y queques porque estos productos los vende en colegio a partir de Marzo. Un día Sonia le gustaría crecer su negocio, y instalarse en Santiago con un local y seguir vendiendo sus productos. Sonia tiene 72 años, tiene 4 hijos y 4 nietos. Le gusta trabajar con Fondo Esperanza por la unión que hay en los grupos y el fortalecimiento de las relaciones entre ellos.
texts.en: Sonia lives in Curicó, Chile, where she sells bread, cakes, and skin creams.  The creams are for face and body and are 100% natural.  She buys them from Temuco and sells them in Curicó and Santiago.  She's going to use her loan to buy creams, to put away a little money, and to purchase ingredients for making bread and cakes to sell at the school starting in March.  One day Sonia would like to grow her business and open up a shop Santiago and keep selling her wares.  She's seventy-two and has four children and four grandchildren.  She likes working with Fondo Esperanza because of the unity and the strength of relationships within the groups.

loans.use: to buy skin creams, ingredients for bread and cakes, and to put away a little in savings.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Joven Juan Carlos trabaja para una empresa privada, su  mayor sueño es tener su casa propia y mejorar de condiciones el y su familia. a el se le dificulta un poco reunir el dinero por que tiene que cubrir los gastos del hogar, con este credito comprara lo necesario par continuar con la construccion, como puertas, cemento, arena etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, a young man, works for a private company. His biggest dream is to have his own house and improve his family’s living conditions. It is difficult for him to collect all the money he needs, because he has to pay for the home’s expenses.

This is why he is requesting a loan to buy everything he needs to continue building his house, such as doors, cement and sand. He appreciates the help that AFODENIC and Kiva give him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 57 years old and married. She is the mother of four children. She lives in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Teofila plants and harvests corn, which she sells to her contract buyer in town. She has been in this business for 15 years. Aside from corn production, she also has a business selling snack foods in the community. Through her sideline business, she earns a monthly income of PHP 550 and through her corn harvesting she earns about PHP 2,100 per month.

Teofila joined GDMPC to gain financial access to capital. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana is 25 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market in Montserrado county.   She is single, with two children aged 3 and 6 years, who live with her and are in school.  For the past two years, she been selling  cosmetics at the local market.  The rainy season is one of her biggest challenges.   Joana is requesting a loan to purchase  cosmetics for her  business.  She likes her business because people responded very positively to it.  Her long term plan is to buy a small piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase  cosmetics for her  business,

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 56 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidenal. She owns and operates a charcoal business in the local community to earn a living. She's been with her business for over 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2009, and now she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for charcoal selling.

loans.name: Reunion Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Reunion” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are requesting a loan of 2,800,000 Sierra Leone leones from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Sahr. Sahr is age 51; he was born in Koidu city, in eastern Sierra Leone, but he is currently residing in Makeni, together with his wife and six children. His wife is a businesswoman and five of his children are attending primary and secondary schools.  

Sahr sells gara lappers (locally dyed clothes) and body lotions. With his share of this loan, he is going to expand his business by producing a larger quantity of gara clothes for sale. He will also buy a large quantity of body lotions to add to his current ones.

loans.use: to buy materials for producing gara lappers (locally dyed clothes)  in a large quantity in order to produce a larger quantity of gara clothes.

loans.name: Dora's Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of three members who have been accessing loans from ID Ghana since 2010. They are Dora, Charles and Gertrude. They sell foodstuffs, cooking utensils, cloth and eggs.

ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Dora is a 50-year-old trader who is married to Armstrong, a 59-year-old civil servant. They have four children. She sells cooking utensils and eggs, and she has 10 years of experience. She works six days in a week (from Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve her business capital. This is her seventh loan with ID Ghana, and she is requesting an amount of 3,000 GHS (Ghana cedis) to buy more goods to sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 7,800 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils and eggs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro, tiene 42 años de edad, casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al departamento de Intibucá. Leandro toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva más de 15 años de cultivar maíz, frijoles y papas. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. El ha invertido varios prestamos en los cultivos, dándoles buena asistencia, actualmente esta solicitando el onceavo préstamo que es por 15,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar semillas de papas, abonos y va pagar mano de obra para siembra y mantenimiento de estos cultivos. Su objetivo es darle una mejor asistencia para incrementar el volumen de producción para mejorar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Leandro, age 42, is married and has six children.  He lives in a village in the Intibucá department.  Leandro has worked in farming his whole life.

He has been growing corn, beans, and potatoes for over 15 years.  He sells this production at the local market.  He has invested several loans in his crops by providing the crops with good care.

He is now requesting his eleventh loan, and it is for 15,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy potato seeds and manure.  He will also pay for the labor to plant and maintain these crops.  His objective is to give greater care to the crops to increase his production volume in order to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Teodulo

texts.en:
Teodulo is 51 years old and married with three children. He lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For more than seven years, he has owned and operated a motorcycle transportation business in the local community. He earns 3,000 PHP per month. 

Teodulo joined GDMPC in 2009. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP so he can purchase spare parts and tires as well as pay for the registration and maintenance of his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires as well as pay for the registration and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 33 years old and lives in the town of West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is single and lives with her partner. They have three children, between the ages of 10 to 16, that live at home with them, and attend school.

For six years Finda has been running a cook shop (restaurant) at the local market. Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy her ingredients wholesale, so she has to buy them retail, which is much more expensive. She learned how to cook from her mother long time ago and enjoys the interaction with her customers at the restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business. In the future she would like to build her business and own a car.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and married with three children. She lives in Bliss, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over five years, she has owned and operated a Computer Encoding business in the local community, and earns 5,000 PHP per month.

Evelyn joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase an additional computer for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase another Desktop Computer

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 35 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children, ages 9, 11, 14 and 19 years old; all of them are in school and live at home. 

She has been selling soft drinks, juice and cold water for the past three years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the buying. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, juice and cold water for her business. In the future, she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, juice and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Salamatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Salamatu was born in Makeni city 40 years ago. She is married to a trader, and the couple has six children – three in primary school and three in secondary. Salamatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells dishes, bowls, drinks, etc.

This group of entrepreneurs has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Leones for the entire group in order to further expand their respective businesses. Salamatu will use her share of the loan to buy dishes, bowls, drinks, etc., in a large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy dishes, bowls, drinks, etc., in a large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Abu B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 25,700,000 Sierra Leone leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to buy or invest in things that they would not otherwise be able to buy or invest in left with their salaries alone. Some usually use these loans to buy plots of land, house-building materials, to pay school fees for their children, to buy pieces of furniture, etc. And at the end of each month, they use their monthly salaries to repay the loan. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Abu is the leader of this group. The 42-year-old is married to a trader, and the couple has six children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Abu has been a teacher for 17 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, rods, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house. 

(Attached on the right of the photo are pictures of Abu Bakarr and Fatmata, who are members of the group but were not present for a group photo.)

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, rods, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 43 years old and married with three children. She is from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Lorna owns farmland and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests rice to sell in order to earn money for their future. She has been in this business for 11 years and earns 9,000 PHP per month. 

In 2008, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a loan of 9,500 PHP for the purpose of purchasing fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to expand her farm operations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is 21 years old and lives in the town of Ijevan with his parents and brother. He studies at Yerevan State University, in the department of history. 

Ashot's parents work hard to sustain their family and it is very difficult for them to save money for Ashot's education.

Ashot has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition. The loan is very important for Ashot because it will enable him to complete his education and become a good specialist.

He dreams of finding a well-paying job so he can help his parents sustain their family.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 33 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is married and has three children between the ages of 9 and 18 years, who live with her and are in school.

For a year, she has been selling soft drinks, biscuits, bread, and cookies and opes to expand her business. The rainy season is her biggest challenge. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional inventory of soft drinks, bread etc. for her business. She likes her business because of the way people positively responded to it. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase  soft drinks, biscuits,bread, and cookies, for her  business,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more material to sew and sell to customers.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Fatmata from Moriba town Bo. She is married, with three children. Her children are currently attending school. She started this food business because she did not go to school and her mother trains her with business.

Fatmata runs a local food business. She sells palm oil and gari. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business eight hours per day. She says that her business is the only income she has.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to establish herself and her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari for her food business.

loans.name: G.s. La Holla Y El Comal Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario la Holla y  el Comal está conformado por tres mujeres, madres solteras, con 5 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de la Paz Centro. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La Paz Centro se caracteriza por sus comidas y bebidas típicas. Como el quesillo y el tiste. Son mujeres trabajadoras, responsables lo han demostrado en los créditos anteriores en tiempo  y forma. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.
 Gracias a su tenacidad y sus ganas de adelante tienen sus diferentes negocios. María Magda es la coordinadora del grupo   y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa y calzado como pantalones, vestidos, camisas, short, camisetas, juegos de sabanas, toallas, zapatas deportivos, tenis, de cuero , sandalias. La rutina de trabajo de Magda es trabajar unas 10 horas diario de forma ambulante, con un peso de unos 20 kg ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto porque es el sustento de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. El grupo solidario la Holla y el Comal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas  kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "La Holla y El Comal" [the Pot and the Griddle] is made up of three women, single mothers with five children in their care.  They are from Paz Centro, located in the western part of Nicaragua.  La Paz Centro is known for its traditional foods and beverages like quesillos [sour cream quesadillas] and tiste [corn and cacao drink].  They are responsible and hardworking women, which they have shown in every way in prior loans.  Unfortunately, due to lack of resources, none of them was able to go to school.

Thanks to their tenacity and desire to get ahead, each has her own business.  María Magda is the group coordinator and sells footwear and clothing including pants, dresses, shorts, t-shirts, sheet sets, towels, soccer shoes, sneakers, leather shoes, and sandals.  Her routine includes traveling around for ten hours each day with twenty kilos of goods which she offers to current and prospective customers.  She really enjoys running the business because it supports her children.  She is seeking a loan to invest in working capital to stock up her business because in the not-too-distant future she would like to bring in more income.  

The "La Holla y el Comal" solidarity group appreciates the help Kiva lenders offer people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so those people can have a semblance of a decent life.

loans.use: to put into working capital and stock up her business buying and selling footwear and clothing like pants, dresses, shirts, shorts, t-shirts, sets of sheets, towels, soccer shoes, sneakers, leather shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Lydia Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members -- Lydia and Ruth.  They decided to form a group to access credit from ID Ghana in 2011. They sell palm oil and kenkey (sourdough dumplings) respectively.

Lydia is 33 years old. She is married to Maniel, a 37-year-old mason. She sells palm oil with 15 years' experience and works from Monday to Saturday. She buys from the market in the eastern region and sells in the Dansoman community. This is her fifth loan with ID Ghana. She needs a loan of GHS 1,400 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. 

The entire group needs an amount of GHS 2,200 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell to their customers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 28 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county.  She is married, her husband is a teacher.  She did not go to school, but has two children aged 2 and 5, both of whom go to school.  

For more than three years she has been selling soft drinks and bread from a table in front of her house.  Her biggest challenge is rising prices, but she still manages to make a profit.  Her mother helped her to start the business, and she feels that the business enables her to gain her independence.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and bread for her business.  In the future, she plans to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and bread for her business.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 65 years old, from Gata Daku, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widow with 1 child. She owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting rice to earn a living. She has been in business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP per month.

In 2010, Consolacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Consolacion is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to support her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Fatmata from Torkpoi town Bo, a married mother of two children between the ages of two and four years. She started her business to create income for her family.

For five years now, Fatmata has been running a raw fish and chicken business within a busy market area. She works from morning until night, seven days per week. Because whe needs capital to more effectively conduct her enterprise, Fatmata has requested a loan to buy more fish and chicken to sell. The extra income arising from this loan will enable her to increase her business and improve her status.

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more fish and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Kadie from Torkpoi town Bo. She is married, with two children, between the ages of 2 years and 15 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2005, Kadie established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to get a permanent source of income. She works at the business six days per week, nine hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes the business is very difficult to operate because of price inflation.

Kadie requires a loan in order to buy more gari and palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and buy electronic items for her personal use. In the future, Kadie plans to build a house and expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gari and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: María Rebeca

texts.es: María busca el sustento diario tras varias actividades y sacando provecho de lo que aprendió de algunos familiares quienes le enseñaron el negocio de la crianza de cerdos para su posterior comercialización en el mercado,hace 4 años logró establecerla gracias a los conocimientos adquiridos y de la cual está pendiente todo el día, alimentando a los cerdos, aseándolos, etc. Además de esta actividad, María elabora prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros, lo que le permite adicionar sus ingresos para tener el sustento diario sobre su mesa. Cuando ella haya obtenido más ganancias en este negocio, espera poder comprar máquinas de coser para incrementar su negocio de confección de ropa. Ahora María solicita un préstamo para poder adecuar los criaderos de chanchos para que los animales tengan el cuidado necesario y así no sufran de ninguna enfermedad. Aunque a lo largo de los últimos años María ha salido adelante sola, agradece a quienes intervengan con su granito de arena para que ella pueda crecer económica y laboralmente.
texts.en:
María supports herself through various activities, making the most of what she learned from some relatives who taught her the business of raising pigs to sell in the market.  She set up this business four years ago thanks to the knowledge she acquired.  She does this work all day, feeding the pigs, washing them, etc.

In addition to this activity, María makes clothing for women and men, which allows her to add to her income to put food on her table.  She hopes to be able to buy sewing machines to expand her clothing business when she has earned more profits from this business.

Currently María's requesting a loan to be able to make adjustments to the pig pens so the animals get the care they need and don't suffer any illness.

Although in the past few years María has gotten ahead alone, she's grateful to the people who make their contribution so she can grow financially and in her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make adjustments to the pens

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La Sra. Marisol tiene 22 años, tiene un hijo de 1 años, se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace 3 años ella confecciona ropa deportiva, su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Carpenter. Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Marisol va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión. La Sra. Marisol enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes, La Sra. Marisol es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Marisol is 22 and has a one-year-old son. For the past three years, she has been making sportswear in the workshop in her home in Carpenter. This will be her first loan cycle with the institution, and Marisol will use the loan to buy fabric to make garments to sell at wholesale. She is requesting the loan to increase working capital.

The business challenge Marisol faces is increasing income. She will invest her profit in the purchase of material to make high-quality garments and fill more customer orders. Marisol works hard and is happy and grateful for the institution's support.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 48 years old from Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Merlinda owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas and coconuts for a living. She has been in business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP per month.

In 2008, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a loan of 23,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to Increase the income of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 36 years old, married with 7 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community, to earn a living. She's been in this business for over 6 years and earns 7,000PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in 2010. Gina is requesting a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes and dreams for her children to have a better future and that they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Joeclyn is a 49 years old, married with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for over 5 years and earns 5,500 PHP every month.

Joeclyn joined GDMPC last year and is requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar to sell at her retail store. She hopes and dreams of being able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 35 years old and married, with four children between the ages of 5 years and 18 years. She runs a cookery shop in Kandeh town Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for eight years and sells cooked food and pure water in her neighborhood. She started this business because she wants to create a source of living. She says, at present, cookery is the best business for her because they get their daily food out of the cookery sales.  

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more foodstuff, like rice, cooking oil, and cooking seasonings, in order to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business to the shop level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff for her business, like rice, cooking oil, and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Hawa from Kandeh town Bo. She is married, with three children between the ages of three months and eight years. She started a business because she did not go to school; her mother trained her to do business.

Hawa runs a general food commodities business. She sells palm oil, dried fish, and bread. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business throughout the week. She says that her business is doing well. 

Hawa has requested a loan in order to buy more food stock, like palm oil and dried fish. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living and to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more food stock for her business, like palm oil and dried fish.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 20-year-old single young woman. She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Maha's brother appears in her Kiva profile photo. She is a university student who wants to complete her studies. Maha's mother is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

Maha is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. She will use her laptop to do her homework and papers and help in her studies. Her loan will ensure a better future for Maha and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop computer

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 50 años , esta casado con Miram  y tiene 4 hijos  cuenta con una casa propia , lugar donde vive junto a toda su familia.El trabajo de Walter consiste en la compra y venta de pescado fresco, realiza ésta actividad desde hace 3 años con ayuda de 2 colaboradores quienes se encargan de apoyarlo en la selección, traslado y venta de los pescados, de esta manera  puede mantener a su familia tranquila , su constante ánimo de superación ha hecho que incursione aun mas en este negocio logrando tener una buena cartera de clientes  . Eventualmente, él mismo realiza la pesca de las especies de mayor demanda cada 2 semanas , ademas precisa que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, considera que lo más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que emanan los pescados, ya que este se le impregna en la ropa y el cuerpo, a pesar de ello espera tener en el futuro un vehículo con aire acondicionado que le permita transportar y conservar sus productos mucho mas frescos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 700 soles para la compra de una nueva red de pesca con todos los implementos requeridos para cumplir su labor, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el paso de sus cuotas de manera puntual . ,
texts.en:
Walter, 50, is married to Miram and has four children.  He lives in his own house with his whole family.

Walter's job is buying and selling fresh fish.  He has done this work for three years with the help of two assistants who help him select, transport, and sell the fish.  This way he can keep his family comfortable.  His constant spirit of self-improvement has made him make further incursions into this business, managing to get a good customer portfolio.  Occasionally, every two weeks, he himself fishes for the species in greatest demand.

He also specifies that what he likes most about his job is talking with his customers.  The most difficult part is tolerating the intense odor that comes from the fish, because it permeates his clothing and his body.  In spite of this he hopes to have an air-conditioned vehicle in the future to transport his fish and keep it much fresher.

Currently he'll request 700 soles [PEN] to buy a new fishing net with all the implements he needs to do his job.  He's committed to making his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fishing tools

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz vive en Curicó y vende pan centeno y queque. Hace más de 4 años que tiene su negocio y además vende jabones naturales que compra a una persona de Santiago que hace los productos la misma persona. Vende en Santiago y Curicó a pedido en empresas. Ocupara su préstamo para copra de jabones y guardo un poco de capital para comprar insumos y hacer pan y queque. En el futuro ella le gustaría Establecer su negocio y poder ella misma hacer el pan y queque, pero para ellos necesita tener maquinas especiales y un local. Luz es mama soltera y tiene dos hijos, de 22 y 25 y están en la Universidad, estudian Medicina y Kinesiología. Le ha gustado trabajar con fondo esperanza porque le hace sentir El hacerla bien y apoyada y por la guía constante que tiene.
texts.en:
Luz lives in Curicó and sells rye bread and muffins. She has run her business for four years and also sells natural soaps, which she buys from a vendor in Santiago who makes the products. Luz sells the merchandise to order to businesses in Santiago and Curicó. She will use the loan to buy soaps and buy supplies to make bread and muffins. One day she would like to establish her business and bake the bread and muffins herself, but this requires special machines and a space. 

Luz is a single mother and has two children, ages 22 and 25, who are studying medicine and kinesiology in college. She likes working with Fondo Esperanza because she feels supported and constantly guided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy soaps and buy supplies to make bread and muffins.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё 24 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями в сельской местности. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес, который является самым распространенным среди сельского населения, то есть скотоводством. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она получила много новой информации для себя и довольно, что обучилась на этом курсе. Она намерена срочно открыть свое дело, так как последние годы были для нее очень тяжелыми. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhayo is 24 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in a rural area. She would like to launch her own business of the type most common among the rural population--raising livestock. With this goal she has completed a “Reach for Success” courses organized by the Association of Business Women and obtained a certificate. She has learned much new information and is glad to have taken the course. She plans to launch her business right away as the past few years have been very hard for her. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to buy cattle. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for  launching her new business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22 year old single man from Al-Nusairat.  He has his own business which is to sell electrical home appliances.  His business earns him a good income, but not enough.  

He is looking to improve his home especially the bedroom, the bathroom and the kitchen.  He does not have enough money for this, so he needs a loan of $1,500 from FATEN.  His home will be improved and be ready so Mohammad and his future wife will live in it.  He is pictured in front of his home.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of improving his house

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Isata from Kandehtown Bo, a married mother of five children between the ages of 8 and 20 years, all currently attending school. She began her business because she wants to develop herself and the family.

For 10 years now, Isata has been operating a palm oil business, selling her product by the gallon. She works thoughout the week, and earns additional income from small-scale farming in the village. Isata says that her business is doing well, and she is acquiring new customers everyday.

Isata has requested a loan to buy more palm oil to resell. The extra income arising from this loan will allow her to improve her family status. In the future, she plans to open a food commodities store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 21-year-old single young woman. She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online and her brother appears in her Kiva profile photo. Ola is a university student who wants to complete her studies. Her brother is employed and earns a low salary which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Ola is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. She will use her laptop to do her homework, write reports, and help her in her studies. Her loan will ensure a better future for Ola and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop computer

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
AbdulRahman is a 27-year-old married young man who has two sons and one daughter. He is employed and earns small salary which is not enough to cover his family's needs. AbdulRahman is thinking of a way to raise his income in order to improve his family's living conditions and he is starting a transportation company. He is photographed  next to his new rickshaw.

AbdulRahman is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help purchase a new vehicle to begin a transportation business. His loan will offer him another source of income to help him provide for his family. 

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle to begin a transportation business

loans.name: Tamador

texts.en:
Tamador is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. The picture was taken in his grocery store.

Tamador is a Palestinian woman. She is married and a mother to one son and three daughters. Her husband is employed and earns a small salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past two years, Tamador's husband has had a grocery store, selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable business and a second source of income for the family, but it also needs more support to cover the costs.

Tamador is requesting a USD 2,000 loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request and buy, such as rice, sugar, canned food, and milk. This will increase sales and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase needed stock of basic groceries for her husband's store.

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
Meet Abie, who is 34 years old and from Torkpoi town in the Bo Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children who are 14 and 18 years old. Abie's children are currently attending school. In 2004, she established a food market to raise income to support her household. She works eight hours per day and six days each week. Abie says that her business is doing well. 

Abie is requesting a loan to buy food containers and palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to increase her business and help pay her children's school fees. In the future, Abie plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food containers and palm oil

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Bernadette from Torkpoi town Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 12 and 25. Two of her children are currently attending school. Bernadette runs a food business within a busy market area where she sells onions, pepper, Maggie, palm oil, and gari. She has been running this business for 15 years and works 10 hours per day and 6 days per week. Bernadette says that that her business is doing well.

Bernadette is requesting a loan to buy more onions, pepper, Maggie, palm oil and gari. The extra income from her loan will allow her to increase her business and feed her family. In the future, Bernadette plans to open a food store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy onions, pepper, Maggie, palm oil and gari

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio es un joven que tiene  28 años, realiza venta de pacas de ropa en su negocio ayudado por su esposa quien trabaja con él, tienen una hija de 8 meses la cual para él es el mejor regalo que le ha dado la vida por quien trabaja a diario para salir adelante y brindarle bienestar económico a su familia que va creciendo, este trabajo es su único medio para cubrir sus gastos, este es el primer crédito que solicita para aumentar su inventario comprando 2 pacas de zapatos, 2 de pantalones y 2 de camisas para ofrecerle variedad a sus clientes  y con el tiempo poder cumplir su sueño más grande, tener una tienda donde pueda vender electrodomésticos y más variedad de ropa.
texts.en:
Julio, 28, is a young man that sells used clothes he buys in bales. His wife works with him and helps him. They have an 8-year-old daughter, the best gift life has given him and the reason for working every day, fighting to get ahead and provide all the support that she and his growing family need. This activity is his only source of income.

This is Julio’s first loan. He will use it to buy two bales of shoes, two of pants and two of shirts in order to offer his customers a wider variety. With time, he hopes to make his dream come true: to have a store where he can sell home appliances and a greater assortment of clothes.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 39 years old and married with five children between the ages of five and 20 years old. Four of her children attend school. Fatmata runs a store where she sells palm oil and beans in Kandeh Town in Sierra Leone. She started her business to help her husband take care of their family.  

Fatmata is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase shoes to sell at her store. She will use her loan to expand her business and hopes that her extra income will help her to provide food and shelter for her family. In the future, Fatmata would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell at her store

loans.name: Kema

texts.en:
Kema is 34 years old and married with four children between the ages of seven and 21. Three of her children go to school and she has one additional dependent at home. For the past eight years, Kema has run a food stand in Kandeh town, Bo Southern area in Sierra Leone where she sells palm oil, gari, and rice. She also receives income from her brother. Kema's main business challenges are the slow purchasing power of her customers and transportation costs.

Kema is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more general stock such as palm oil, rice, and gari. The extra income from her loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Kema would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, and gari

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Meet Watta from Kulanda Town in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is 36 years old with three children and they all go to school. Watta runs a clothing store selling blouses, skirts and shirts. She works at her business 15 hours a day, 6 days a week.  

Watta requested the loan to purchase more clothing for her store to sell during the dry season. She says that her challenge is that during the rainy season, business is slow.  The loan will help her expand her business and educate her children. In five years, she wants to grow her business into a large store that sells all sorts of different items, not just clothes. She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Esther B.

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Esther from Kandeh Town, Bo in Sierra Leone. She is a single parent with three children, between the ages of 3 and 18. She sells palm oil and bush meat 9 hours per day, 7 days per week at the market and along the highway. Esther decided to start her business when she was unable to further her education. She says that palm oil is getting more scarce but she has a good relationship with her old suppliers that will keep her well stocked.  

Esther has requested the loan to buy more stock to expand her business. The extra income will help her finish building her house and rent it out to generate more income for her family. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as palm oil and bush meat

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Princess from Kandeh Town in Sierra Leone. She is married with five adult children. Her husband is a retired worker. Princess operates a store selling assorted beverages, including fresh milk and soft drinks. She initially started her business to improve herself and her store sold local foodstuff such as gari and palm oil.   

Princess requested this loan from BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more inventory for the expansion of her business. She says that her customer demand for her products is very strong but she does not have the capital to purchase sufficient stock. The extra income generated from the loan will help improve her standard of life. In the future, she hopes to own and operate more shops in the area. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more inventory such as milk and soft drinks

loans.name: Nenneh

texts.en: Meet 35-year-old Nenneh from Moriba Town in Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 13. One of her children currently attends school, and her husband is a teacher. She sells gari (processed cassava flour) and works every day at her business. She first started the business to improve herself and to take care of her children. The business is going well, and she is applying for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to buy more inventory to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from the loan will help give her the ability to take better care of her children and to take her business to another level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gari (processed cassava flour), and expand her business.

loans.name: Animata

texts.en: Animata is 31 years old, married, and has three children, between the ages of 2 to 10. She runs a store in Kandeh Town in Sierra Leone. Her business is open seven days a week. She sells mobile phones, clothes, coolers and food containers to hotels and offices in the area. She was inspired by her mother, a strong businesswoman, to enter into business. Her store is doing well, and she is now looking to expand. She applied for this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more inventory for her business. Her goal is to grow her business to be one of the largest in her community in the next five years. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more inventory, such as mobile phones, clothes, coolers and food containers, for her business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Musu from Kandeh Town. She is widowed and has four children between the ages of 15 and 23. Musu runs a store where she sells palm oil, rice and gari (processed cassava flour). She works at the business throughout the week and has two employees working for her. Musu says that the business is going well and that she is looking to expand her business. She first started her business in order to educate her children. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her living conditions and those of her family. In the future, she plans to continue to grow her shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy inventory, such as gari (processed cassava flour), palm oil and rice, to expand her business.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu is 39 years old, widowed, and has three children, ages 7 years to 15 years. She runs a food stand at Moriba Town in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She began her business because she need a permanent source of income to support her children. She has been in this business for the past 10 years, and she sells fish, onions, and rice in a busy market area. Storage is one of the big challenges she faces in her business. She applied for this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy food commodities, such as fish, cooking oil and rice. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her life and educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support

loans.use: to buy food, such as fish, cooking oil and rice, for her food stand.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 28-year-old single young man. He is a construction worker who earns small salary which is not enough to cover all his expenses. Ashraf is engaged and is preparing to get married soon after finishing construction on his house. He is photographed in his new house.

Ashraf is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting and purchasing and installing new windows and doors to his house. His loan will enable him to finish his house and prepare himself well to soon get married.

loans.use: to cover the cost of painting and installing new windows and doors for his new house

loans.name: Frances B.

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Frances from Kandeh town in Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of 10 and 24. Her children are currently attending school. In 2005, Frances established a palm oil business to create income to pay her children school fees. She works 14 hours per day, every day. Frances's main business challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Frances is requesting a loan to buy more gallons of palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Frances plans to build a big house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil

loans.name: Joshua S.

texts.en:
Meet 36 year-old Joshua from Kulanda Town, Bo, located in the southern part of Sierra Leone.  He is married with two children, ages 3 and 7.  Joshua's wife is a teacher who also contributes to support the family.  

Joshua runs a local convenience store where he sells assorted items. When he started his business, he only sold shoes but has now expanded to include many other items. Joshua also owns a moto-taxi to generate more income.  

Joshua is requesting a loan to purchase more goods and inventory for his store. He hopes that his loan will generate more income to take care of his family.  Your support is greatly appreciated!

loans.use: to purchase goods and inventory for his store

loans.name: Reyad

texts.en:
Reyad is a 32-year-old young married man and a father to one son. Reyad is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the costs. Reyad and his family are suffering from the humidity in their house, which makes their house's living condition not healthy and not suitable to live in.

Reyad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing necessary materials to fix the humidity in his house. This will enable Reyad and his family to enjoy living in suitable home conditions.

Reyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: To fix the humidity in the house

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, tiene 21 años es soltero y aún no tiene hijos porque espera consolidarse económicamente para formar su propia familia, actualmente vive en casa de sus padres junto a su abuela y sus 2 hermanos .José trabaja en la venta de prendas de vestir, principalmente  para varones aunque en ocasiones vende prendas para mujer  siempre y cuando sus clientes se lo soliciten , recibe la mercaderia desde Lima ya que un familiar suyo se lo provee. El sistema de ventas es crediticio y el cobro lo hace de manera  diaria, semanal o mensual previo acuerdo con su comprador. Vende directamente entre sus familiares, amigos y vecinos .Asegura que al principio le fue difícil trabajar en la venta de prendas de vestir ya que tenía que enfrentar los comentarios negativos y machistas de las personas que le decían que ese es un trabajo femenino, sin embargo, ahora realiza su labor de manera óptima y sus ingresos se han incrementado, espera algún día establecer una tienda de ropas y por otra parte establecer con el paso del tiempo un centro de diseño gráfico en el que pueda desarrollar su vocación.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometido a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas ya que con el monto solicitado comprará un lote de mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir masculinas como polos, pantalones y jeans.
texts.en:
José, 21, is single and has no children yet because he feels it is best to have your finances in order before starting a family. He lives in his parents' home with his grandmother and two brothers. José mainly sells men's clothing, though when his customers request it, he will sell women's clothes. A relative in Lima sends the merchandise to him. He offers his customers credit on daily, weekly, or monthly terms as agreed. He sells to relatives, friends, and neighbors. At first, selling clothing was difficult because he confronted negative comments that suggested this was work for women. Now, however, the business is going very well, and sales have increased. 

He hopes to have a clothing store one day and to establish a design workshop where he can pursue his vocation. He is applying for a loan of S/. 1000 soles and is grateful to those whose support will help him meet his objectives. He promises to make his payments on time. He will use the loan to buy men's clothing such as polo shirts, pants, and jeans.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 36 años y esta casada con  Josue de 37 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Ella Comparte junto a su familia una casa construida a base de Madera adquirida hace poco.Inicialmente como ama de casa al cuidado del primero de sus hijos apoyo la iniciativa de aperturar un negocio propio en el cual se dedican a la reparación de diversos vehículos.
Esta decisión fue muy sólida ya que en aquel entonces Josue se desempeñaba como ayudante en un taller particular y consideraba tener la capacidad de independizarse.
Llevan casi 15 años en este negocio y con el paso de los años han logrado consolidarse  y tener un buen sustento para el desarrollo de su familia ya que ella se encarga de administrar la tienda que posee en su taller donde expende diversos insumos para la reparación como aceites y repuestos , mientras que su esposo brinda el servicio técnico correspondiente.A manera de surtir nuevamente su negocio y contar con más variedad de productos desea contar con un capital de trabajo.Dentro de sus prioridades a largo plazo esta la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble para asi mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y a su vez tener un mejor ambiente para su negocio.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP razón por la cual solicita 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y aceites para autos .
texts.en:
Esther, 36, lives with her husband Josué, 37, with whom she has three children.  She and her family share a house built of wood that they recently acquired.

Initially, as a housewife caring for her first child, she supported the initiative to open her own business in an auto-repair shop for different vehicles.  This was a very sound decision because at that time Josué was working as an assistant in a private shop and thought he had the ability to go out on his own.

They have had this business for almost 15 years.  Over time they have managed to establish themselves and have a good foundation for the growth of the family.  She's in charge of managing the shop store, where they sell a variety of repair supplies such as oil and parts.  Her husband offers the corresponding technical service.

She needs to have some working capital to re-stock her business and have a greater variety of products.

Among her long-term priorities is to build her house of solid materials to improve her family's quality of life and also to have a better environment for her business.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She's very happy to be part of a strong group in which she hopes to put the best of herself for the growth of her community.  This is why she's requesting 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy parts and oil for a variety of vehicles so she has more supplies for her business.

loans.use: to purchase parts and motor oil for cars

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 39 años es madre soltera de 4 hijos. Actualmente reside en su casa propia que se ubica en un barrio agrícola.Vilma es una mujer ejemplar. El trabajo duro es su principal fuente de ingresos. Lleva más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura, ella siembra arveja, habas, maíz y papa, los cuales cuida constantemente.Su rutina se da inicio en las madrugadas ya que sus cultivos se ubican a media hora de su hogar.  Además posee animales como vacas y toros, los que pasta mientras atiende sus cultivos.“Me gusta lo que hago, con la leche de las vacas preparo quesos y se los vendo a mis vecinos ”, menciona. Por ahora se enfocará en el trabajo de campo razon por la cual sembrará arvejas y maíz, para  ello requiere de su ayuda ya que Con los 500 soles, Vilma podrá adquirir abono organico para sus próximos cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y éste sería su crédito número 3 con MFP. Espera el apoyo de todos de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 39, is a single mother with four children.  Currently she lives in her own house located in a farming neighborhood.  Vilma's an exemplary woman.  Hard work is her main source of income.

She has made a living in agriculture for more than 20 years.  She grows peas, beans, corn, and potatoes, which she takes care of constantly.  Her routine starts early in the morning because her crops are located half an hour from her home.  She also has animals such as cows and bulls, which she grazes while she tends to her crops.

"I like what I do.  With the milk from the cows I make cheese and sell it to my neighbors," she says.  For now she'll focus on the field work because she'll harvest peas and corn, for which she needs your help.

With the 500 soles [PEN] Vilma will be able to get organic fertilizer for her next crops.

She belongs to the Señor de Muruhuay communal bank and this would be her third loan with MFP.  She hopes for everyone's support to continue with her goals.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mabal

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Mabal from Kandeh Town in Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children between the ages of 7 and 18. She sells palm oil at a big market. She began her business because she wanted to earn more income to help her husband take good care of their children. She currently also receives money from her sister. Her business is going smoothly, and she can see her income increase day-by-day. She would like a loan of SLL 900,000. Mabal needs the loan in order to buy more products for her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into one of the big shops in the market and continue to improve her family's living conditions. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Faith from Kandeh Town. She is married and has two children, 6 and 19. Both of her children attend school. She was a housewife, but she started her business to help her husband take care of the family. Faith runs a business selling palm oil and gari (processed cassava flour) at a big market. She applied for the loan from BRAC Sierra Leone to start traveling to Ghana to buy clothes to sell. She would like to use the extra income from her business to educate her children and help her business grow. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Margaret from Moriba Town in the southern part of Bo. She is married and has two children, and she has four additional dependents at home. Margaret runs a palm oil business; she sells gallon containers of palm oil. She has been running this business for 10 years ago. She works at the business seven days a week, 10 hours per day. She says that her business is going well. Margaret has applied for a loan in order to buy more gallon containers of palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a palm oil store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more gallon containers of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Mamie from Torkpoi Town in Bo. She is married and has six children between the ages of 10 and 30. One of her children attends school. Mamie runs a local food business; she sells palm oil, chicken, garden eggs and gari (processed cassava flour). She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business every day, 6 days per week, and she has her children help her run the business. Her business is her only source of income. Mamie says that the main challenges to her business are slow purchasing power of her customers and occasional vehicle breakdowns on her way to the business. Mamie has applied for a loan in order to buy more palm oil, chickens, garden eggs and gari for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and help pay her grandchildren’s fees. In the future, next year, she plans to have a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, chickens, garden eggs and gari (processed cassava flour) for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Paula is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Unidas (United Women) 1, 2, 3 & 4. This group is comprised of 20 micro-entrepreuners (women and men) located on the lush, rugged Samana peninsula. Paula makes her home here in a simple structure, with her long-term partner and their five children.

Paula is excited to be taking her 16th loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. This businesswoman runs different sales in her business, one is selling used sewing machines (for domestic use) and the other is selling coconut oil. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing sewing machines to sell and coconuts from which to extract oil.

Paula said that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them while she has been working to support her long-term partner. She will use the profits to reinvest and to save for any needs in her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy used sewing machines and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a metal door.

loans.name: Concepción Raquel

texts.es:
Concepción tiene 26 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda de productos básicos, desde hace tres años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar arroz, fríjol, maíz, ázucar, jabón, etc,para instalar nuevamente la tienda, debido a que  a su hija le dio una enfermedad y se vio obligada a cerrarla y hoy en día la quiere apertura. Pues, desea ayudarle a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar, mejorando las condiciones de vida de toda su familia. Además, su sueño es reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Concepción is 26 years old and has two children.  She has owned a general store for three years.

She is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to reopen her store and to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, soap etc.  Her daughter gave her an illness and she had to close the store, but now she is ready to open it again.  She wants to help her husband with the household expenses in order to improve her family's quality of life.  Her dream is to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, soap etc in order to reopen her store.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Meet 45-year-old Salamatu from Torkpoi Town, Bo, in Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of 15 and 25. Two are currently attending school. In 2003, Salamatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income to support her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says her business is doing fine. Salamatu needs a loan in order to buy more food provisions, such as oranges. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions, such as oranges, for her retail business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una joven de 29 años de edad quien actualmente vive en Sololá junto a sus padres. Ella tiene 5 hermanas de ellas 4 estas casadas y viven independientemente y una hermana menor quien ayuda en los oficios del  hogar.
Ella se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en una tienda que tiene a unos kilómetros de su vivienda, empezó con esta actividad viendo la necesidad de generar ingresos para la familia  ya que por la falta de empleos en la comunidad decide hacer la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes que adquirió hace un año, ella aprendió a realizar este negocio hace tres años cuando trabajaba con unos vecinos fuera de su comunidad y fue donde ella tuvo la experiencia en realizar esta actividad.
Ella ve que la demanda de sus clientes y su ganancias son buenas  de esta manera quiere ampliar esta tienda solicitando un préstamo  de Q 10,000.00 para comprar más variedad de abarrotes ampliando la tienda  para brindar un mejor servicio y obtener mejores ingresos para la familia. 
Su mayor sueño es que en un futuro pueda construir una vivienda mejorada y seguir apoyando el desarrollo de la familia.
texts.en:
María is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Sololá with her parents.  She has five sisters; four of whom are married and live independently, and one younger sister who helps with the household tasks.  María makes a living selling groceries in a store that she has a few kilometers from her home.  She started this business after seeing the need to generate income for her family.  Since there was a lack of jobs in the community she decided to start a grocery store which she acquired a year ago.   She learned how to run this business three years ago when she worked with some neighbors outside of her community where she gained experience in this activity.

María sees that her customer's demand and her income are good, so she wants to expand her store.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 GTQ to buy a larger assortment of groceries, thus increasing her store in order to offer better service and get a better income for her family.  Her great dream is that in the future she can build a better home and continue supporting the growth of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries in order to expand her store.

loans.name: Celina Gisvel

texts.es:
Celina es una joven muy entusiasta y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, la vivienda donde habita Celina se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor y se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, espárragos, entre otros.  Celina aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y ella empezó a apoyarlos para poder salir adelante, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Celina trabaja como empleada domestica, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres, Celina cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y honrada.

Celina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina  a gas, ya que actualmente su cocina es de kerosene y hace algunos días tuvo un pequeño accidente que gracias a Dios no paso a mayores, es por ello que con este gran apoyo podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Celina is a very enthusiastic young adult with a lot of motivation to get ahead.  The house Celina lives in is located in the city of Ica, which is characterized by having a very warm and friendly climate.  A lot of agricultural work is done here, and cotton, grapes and asparagus are commonly grown, among other things.  Celina learned to work when she was very young since her parents had few economic resources.  She began to help them to be able to get ahead, and due to this she was only able to study until 5th grade, but would have liked to have been able to go to university.
