Leticia is a responsible wife and mother to her three grown children. She has been able to educate her three children from the profits she earned through farming and her general store.

Leticia would like to expand the merchandise she offers to her local community. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of PHP 30,000, which will allow her to buy merchandise for her store such as eggs, canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks and assorted biscuits. Expanding her inventory will enable her to satisfy her customers' demands and earn a higher income. 

She is grateful for the help she has received from lenders. It has enabled her to improve her way of life and make her general store a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as eggs, canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks and assorted biscuits for her general store.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en:
Bonny is a 45-year-old married man living in Hioma, Uganda. He is a farmer who also sells produce for a living. Bonny's major business challenges are the high cost of transportation and the effect of weather on the roads he uses to transport his produce. 

Bonny is requesting a loan to buy produce, such as maize and beans, to sell. His business plan is to buy a truck to help him transport his goods. Bonny is a good father who desires to educate his children through the university level as well as set up sustainable income-generating activities for his family.

loans.use: to buy produce, such as maize and beans, to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 56-year-old married man with 18 children, eight of whom attend school. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Charles runs a rental and agriculture business and has been able to use his proceeds to pay school fees for his children. Three of his children have now graduated and he has been able to set up businesses for his children who refused to go to school.  Charles's major business challenges are unpredictable weather and price fluctuations that impact his business.

Charles is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to be the leading cocoa producer and to educate his children through university.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Rhona Lee

texts.en:
Rhona Lee is 21 years old and has one child. For the past two years, she has run a pig-fattening in the Philippines. Rhona Lee has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Rhona Lee is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is happily married to a farmer. The couple is grateful because they are blessed with six children, four of whom currently go to school, one who is out of school, and the youngest, who is an infant. She and her husband work together to earn a living. For the past eight years, Rebecca has owned and operated a retail store. She is thankful because her business has improved through her determination, patience, and market adaptation strategies. Rebecca struggles to replace her stocks of merchandise when they sell out but she does not have enough income.

Rebecca is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of merchandise such as cases of soft drinks, eggs, assorted biscuits, cooking ingredients, and canned goods. She hopes that her loan will continue to increase her income to enable her to educate her children through a high level so they will obtain a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cases of soft drinks, eggs, assorted biscuits, cooking ingredients, and canned goods

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 43-year-old, married woman from Garcia, Bohol. She has four children. The eldest is 18 and the youngest is seven. 

She has been engaged in the motorcycle transportation business for six years now. Her monthly income is PHP 12,000. This is the source of her income to cover her expenses. 

Erlinda is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for her motorcycle. She wants her motorcycle to be in good condition whenever it is used in transportation. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the equipment that she needs for her motorcycle. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell in her general store, like soft drinks, shampoo, soap, and sugar.

Merlinda has been in this business for 26 years. Merlinda earns more income from pig fattening. Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like soft drinks, shampoo, soap, and sugar.

loans.name: Jeniskul

texts.ru: Женискуль 54 года, вдова, имеет 4 детей.Муж Женискуль скоропостижно скончался. Они начинали свой бизнес с мужем, после его смерти она осталась с детьми одна со всеми житейскими проблемами. Несмотря на все проблемы она остается все такой же жизнерадостной и веселой. Она твердо уверена в светлое будущее своей семьи. Опорой для Женискуль являются её дети, кторые активно помогают по хозяйству. Женискуль в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Женискуль сумела развить свой бизнес с 1,200 KGS сегодня ежемесячный доход бизнеса составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Женискуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 5 овец, для увеличения прибыли о продажи молока и перепродажи скота. Доходы от кредита Женискуль планирует вложить в расширение увеличения количества скотины. Она мечтает сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en: Jeniskul is 54 years old, a widow, and the mother of four. Jeniskul’s husband has died prematurely. She had launched her business together with her husband. After he passed away, she was left to raise the children and face all life challenges on her own. In spite of all problems, she remains optimistic and upbeat. She believes in a better future for her family. Jeniskul finds support in her children, who actively help out on the farm. As the main source of income for her family, Jeniskul raises livestock and grows produce. Thanks to her perseverance and hard work, Jeniskul has been able to develop her business from a starting sum of 1,200 KGS; today, the monthly income from her business is 9,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Jeniskul turned to “Bai Tushum and Partners” for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to buy two cows and five sheep, to increase revenues from milk and cattle sales. Jeniskul plans to use the revenues resulting from her loan to expand her livestock. She  dreams of being able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows and 5 sheep.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora, age 34, is managing a pharmacy as a source of income. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional medicines to offer. She aims to help others through giving an affordable price for her medicine. She is looking more to help than to make a profit. 

She will feel very happy if her requested loan will be approved in order to offer a lower price to the villagers.

loans.use: to buy additional medicines for her pharmacy that she can sell to the villagers at a lower price.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fish in the Philippines and earns additional income from plasticwares.  Ruth is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase crabs, fish, and other seafood to sell.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase crabs, fish, and other seafood to sell.

loans.name: Luz Del Día Group

texts.es: Doña Josefina tiene 56 años ella es originaria de una localidad rica en cultura y belleza en sus montes ya que los pobladores cuidan y protegen las zonas ya que muy cerca de su población se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca la cual es visitada por turistas de casi todo el mundo. Josefina es parte de un grupo llamado Luz del Día, dice que a través de los créditos su negocio a crecido mucho, dice que ella empezó con una pequeña mesita con la venta de dulces hace mas de 15 años y que luego poco a poco fue invirtiendo en productos no perecederos y luego compro fruta y verdura. Ahorita tiene una tienda más grande en su casa que esta a lado de la carretera que lleva al santuario de la mariposa y a la zona arqueológica de Zirahuato, también muy visitada. Dice que lleva varios ciclos trabajando con VisionFund y que le ha servido de mucho sus créditos ella dice “desde que comencé a trabajar con la financiera tengo mejor surtida mi tienda y así mis vecinos no se van a otras tiendas a comprar ya que tengo lo necesario de productos para venderles, agradezco a VisionFund porque me ayuda a mejorar mi changarrito”. Ella está pidiendo el crédito por que comprara jabón, cloro, huevo, leche, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, atún, chiles en vinagre, sardinas, papel higiénico, enlatados etc. Dice que le servirá mucho el crédito por que también quiere comprar un poco de mercería ya que en su comunidad las mujeres suelen hacer costuras para vender en los lugares turísticos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Audelia, Leónides y Yolanda ellas invertirán sus créditos en mejorar sus negocios como en una mercería, en una combi de transporte público y en la compra de ropa para damas y niños para su venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefina, 56, is originally from a region with great cultural wealth and beautiful mountains. Locals take good care of nature because close to their village, lies the Monarch Butterfly Biosphere Reserve, visited by tourists from all over the world.

Josefina is a member of the "Luz del día" [Daylight] group. She says that thanks to the loans, her business has grown a lot. She started with a small table, selling sweets more than fifteen years ago. Step by step, she started buying nonperishable food and after a while, fruits and vegetables. She now has a larger store at home, which is located by the road leading to the reserve and the archaeological area of Zirahuato, which is also very popular.

Josefina says that she has been working with VisionFund for several cycles and that their loans have helped her a lot. She says: "since I started working with the institution, my store is better stocked and my neighbors choose it over other stores, since I have everything they need. I thank VisionFund because they help me improve my small store."

Josefina is requesting a loan to buy soap, bleach, eggs, milk, sugar, beans, oil, tuna fish, chilies with vinegar, sardines, toilet paper and canned food, among other things. She says that the loan will help her a lot because she also wants to buy some sewing supplies, since there are many women in her community that normally make handicrafts to sell to tourists.

The remaining members are Audelia, Leónides and Yolanda. They will use their loans to improve a sewing supplies store and a van used for public transport and to buy women and children’s clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, bleach, eggs, chilies with vinegar, oil, beans and other supplies for her store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Dedication and perseverance have been Evangeline's guiding principles in improving her sales and profit. Nowadays, she aims for continuous development of her income and sales, so she can secure her family's future. 

To make all these things realizable, Evangeline is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which allows her to re-stock her variety (sari-sari) store. She believes that her business will continue to grow smoothly because she devotes most of her time to running her variety store. 

Evangeline hopes for continuous access to financial services and lenders, so she can educate her three children and give them a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store, such as cooking oil, ingredients, instant noodles, assorted biscuits, soft drinks, and different kinds of soap.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: En un lugar del estado de Michoacán, hay una presa la cual pertenece a un sistema hidroeléctrico,  un lugar donde se puede practicar la pesca, el campismo y otras actividades recreativas, este sitio es muy visitado sobretodo en la época de vacaciones de semana santa, pues las autoridades municipales, organizan actividades recreativas. Doña Sofía es originaria de este hermoso lugar del cual está  muy orgullosa, ella pertenece a un grupo llamado Los Girasoles y está muy contenta de pertenecer al grupo por que cuando tienen algún conflicto o problema entre todas se apoyan para salir adelante. Cuenta que  vive con su esposo y que en su casa tienen un puesto de dulces regionales que ella misma elabora como ate de guayaba y membrillo, leche dura y  conserva de calabaza, higo, durazno, ate de guayaba relleno de cajeta, pulpas de tamarindo, dice que le enseñaron hacer sus dulces un grupo de personas que le dio un curso por parte del ayuntamiento de su población para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Dice que tiene con este negocio desde hace 20 años y que también se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama, sale a vender su ropa a sus vecinas de su localidad y vende las prendas en pagos para que no se les haga pesado. Sus dulces los vende a diferentes comerciantes que tienen puestos en el mercado de la población de Zitácuaro los cuales venden artesanías y ella le surte los dulces. Está pidiendo un crédito para comprar materia prima para hacerlos y poder vender un poco más ya que en el mes de marzo son los días de mejores ventas ya que en la semana santa hay mucho turista en su localidad. Agradece a VisionFund por la ayuda prestada ya que gracias a los créditos que ha pedido sus negocios han mejorado poco a poco. Las otras trece integrantes del grupo se llaman Graciela, Gabriela, Paulina, Felipa, Sofía S. Verónica, Teresa, Itxe, María Guadalupe, Juana, Ma. Remedios, Raquel y Ofelia ellas invertirán en artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes como productos no perecederos, para la compra de pollo por kilos para vender, en una refaccionaria, en una tienda de ropa, compra productos por catalogo para su venta y  en una papelería.
texts.en:
In the state of Michoacán, there is a much-visited hydroelectric dam and reservoir where people fish, camp, and enjoy other recreational activities organized by the city, especially during the Easter week vacation. Sofía is proud to be from this beautiful area. She is happy to be a member of the communal bank Los Girasoles (The Sunflowers) because whenever their is a disagreement or problem, everyone works together to move ahead. She lives with her husband and has a stand in her house where she sells regional candies that she makes herself from guayaba and quince meat, milk, pumpkin preserve, figs, peaches, caramel, and tamarind pulp. She learned to make the candies at a workshop presented by the mayor's office and designed to raise living standards. 

She has been making candies for 20 years. She also sells women's clothing to neighbors, offering payment terms that they can afford. She sells her candies to various handicraft merchants who have stands in the Zitácuaro market; she provides them with a sweets selection. Sofía is applying for a loan to buy ingredients to make more candies for the Easter holidays in March, when sales are high because many tourists are in town. 

She thanks VisionFund for its support, as the loans have helped her slowly build her business. The other 13 members of the group are Graciela, Gabriela, Paulina, Felipa, Sofía S., Verónica, Teresa, Itxe, María Guadalupe, Juana, Ma. Remedios, Raquel, and Ofelia. They will use the loan to stock a grocery store with non-perishable items, to buy chicken by the kilo to sell, to buy spare parts, to buy clothing for inventory, to buy catalog merchandise to sell, and to buy stationery items.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing to sell and to buy supplies to make regional candies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria de 42 años , es soltera y tiene 4 hijos ,con quienes viven en su casa propia . La actividad que realiza Gloria es la venta de pescado fresco por las mañanas. Su labor empieza por las madrugadas dirigiéndose al puerto pesquero de la localidad a comprar su mercadería directamente de los pescadores mayoristas, luego los lleva a su puesto de ventas en el mercado mas cercano a su hogar. Se inició hace más de 3 años con su propio capital, viendo que era un trabajo fácil de realizar y de mucha demanda, decidió dedicarse completamente a desarrollarla y desde entonces ha mantenido constante su inversión inicial. Hasta el momento le apoyan ocasionalmente sus hijas mayores en las ventas. Antes de iniciar su negocio, tenía problemas económicos ya que  se había separado del padre de sus hijos y con la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico ya que con la pensión que recibía por sus hijas no les alcanzaba, entonces  se decidió a empezar a vender.Viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, espera  ver crecer su negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de pescado fresco tales como palometa, boquichico y bagre ya que estas especies son de mayor demanda por el mercado. Por otro lado esta agradecida con el apoyo financiero que le brinda MFP para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old, single and has 4 children, who live with her in her own house.  The business that Gloria carries out is selling fresh fish in the mornings.  Her work starts at dawn, heading to the fishing port of her town to buy her merchandise directly from the wholesale fishermen.  Later she brings them to her salesplace in the market closest to her home.  

She started more than 3 years ago with her own capital, and seeing that it was easy work to carry out with a lot of demand, decided to dedicate herself completely to developing it.  Since then, she has maintained her initial investment.  Until now, her older daughters have occasionally helped her with sales.  Before starting her business, she had economic problems since she had separated from the father of her children.  Needing to have an income, since the support she received for her children wasn't enough, she decided to start selling.  Seeing the good results she has, she wants to see the business grow and then have a higher income.  

She is requesting 1500 soles to buy fresh fish like pompano, boquichico and catfish, since these species are of higher demand in the market.  She is very grateful for the economic support that MFP brings to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Aliham

texts.en:
Aliham is a responsible housewife who sells snacks in the school canteen to help, and to increase, her husband's income. She is 29 years old and has one child. 

Aliham wants to improve her business, increase her income to meet their necessities, and support their child's education.  She wants to ask for loan of 10,000 PHP to buy bananas, eggs, milk, and sugar to make snacks.  

In the future, she is hopes her business will grow and her child will have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, eggs, milk, and sugar for her snack-making business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a thirty-one-year-old married man with two children, aged 12 and 4, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. In order to provide basics to his family, he started a clothing shop and the business has been very profitable. He desires to educate his children up to the university. Price fluctuations and the ever-changing customer preferences affect the business while his desire is to own a modern boutique. John intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es: Piedad, de 35 años de edad esta divorciada y es madre de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia, la cual logro construir con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Piedad es la ejecución y dirección de obras de construcción. Trabaja en la implementación de áreas de trabajo, construcción de infraestructura, consultoría de obras y otros servicios relacionado a este rubro. Se inició en esta labor hace 7 años, pero luego de los primero 4 años tuvo que dejarlo por falta de capital y otros motivos personales, ahora lo está retomando con mucho optimismo . Actualmente cuenta con una oficina en casa en donde elabaora los planos o prospectos que requieren las obras. Afortunadamente ya ha obtenido buenos resultados y en este mes tiene mucho más trabajo por realizar.Nos comenta que esta actividad es muy rentable porque en su localidad se están desarrollando muchos proyectos de remodelación e implementación de zonas lo que le permite ir en busca de nuevos clientes que accedan a su opción de trabajo. Hasta el momento ha tenido buenos ingresos económicos situacion que la deja satisfecha y con ganas de seguir adelante en sus proyectos. Espera que su negocio siga creciendo y anhela implementarlo con nuevos y mejores equipos técnicos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2200 soles con los cuales comprará papeles especiales para elaborar planos, plumones de dibujo técnico y tinta para imprimir planos.
texts.en:
Piedad, 35, is the mother of three children who live with her in the house she build with hard work. Piedad manages construction projects: she develops workplaces, builds infrastructure, and offers project consulting and other related services. She started her business seven years ago, though she shut it down after four years because she lacked working capital and had personal issues to deal with. She is open again and is very optimistic.

She has an office in her home where she creates layouts and prospectuses for projects. This has been very successful, and she has a lot of work pending this month. She says the work is very profitable because there are many renovation and development projects underway in her area, which lets her seek out new clients for her work. She is satisfied with her income and wants to continue with her projects. She expects the business to grow and hopes to develop it with new and better technical tools. She is applying for a loan of S/. 2200 soles to buy paper for layouts, drawing pens, and ink to make documents.

loans.use: to buy paper for layouts, drawing pens, and ink to make documents.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Daisy has been in this business for six years; she earns additional income from a general store. 

Daisy has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport.

She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spareparts for the maintenance of her tricycle used for her transportation business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman, 36 years old, from Garcia, Bohol. She has four children. The eldest is 18 and the youngest is 8 years old. She has been engaged in a 'sari-sari' or variety store business for 10 years now. This is the source of her income for family consumption. Her husband is a welder.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to sell like detergent, soap, shampoo, coffee, and soft drinks. This are the items that she sells in her store. By the help of the loan, she will be able to buy more items to be stocked in her store.

In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her business. She also wants to repair their home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell like detergent, soap, shampoo, coffee, and soft drinks

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 47 years old and has seven children. Agnes is married and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Agnes requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Agnes has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Agnes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a 43-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who has specialized in banana and beans growing.He also has poultry and brick laying projects in order to diversify his income sources. Diseases and inadequate capital affect his business while his dream is to venture into modern farming so as to realize high yields. Boniface intends to use the loan to buy chicks and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy chicks and pay for labor.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 37 years old, married and has two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Dina has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Dina has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Dina would like to save enough money to be able to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Julio Vicente

texts.es:
Julio vive en Libertad, tiene 35 años. El era ayudante de albañil pero al darse cuenta que era necesario sostener su hogar con un negocio comenzo a independizarce y tener su propio negocio de venta de refrescos. 

El realiza su trabajo de lunes a domingo de 10 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde vendiendo jugos de coco, su mayor dificultad es no contar con un local para comercializar sus jugos.

Está casado tiene dos hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal y su esposa ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa.Juntos se esfuerzan día a día para sacar adelante a su familia. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar bebidas de cocos para vender. El sueño del cliente es alquilar un local y vender al por mayor y tener sus empleados pero con esto requiere de comprar mas materia prima para la preparación de los jugos.
texts.en:
Julio, 35, lives in Libertad.  He used to be a bricklayer’s helper but when he realized that he needed to support his household with a business he started becoming independent and having his own soft-drink business.  He works from Monday to Sunday from ten in the morning until 6 in the evening.  His wife helps with the household chores and together they strive daily to move their family forward.

He wants to use the loan to buy coconut drinks to sell.  His dream is to rent a locale in order to sell at wholesale and to have employees but to do so needs to buy more raw materials to make the drinks.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make coconut juice.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a married woman and earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She lives with her family in Bohol, Philippines. 

Mylene is applying for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries. With these goods, she will be able to sell and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit. Mylene hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Divinagracia

texts.en:
Divinagracia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her dry goods business.

Divinagracia has been in this business for 40 years. Divinagracia earns additional income from electronic card re-loading.

Divinagracia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She owns a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending and clothing sales. Gina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es:
El grupo de las Artesanas del Fresno lleva varios ciclos solicitando crédito a la institución esta vez solo quedaron seis integrantes tres de ellas son nuevas y tres de ellas ya estaban trabajando con la institución. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque ellas se dedican a la elaboración de bordados. Doña Zenaida se integra al grupo ella tiene 42 años de edad está casada desde hace 21 años con el señor Román juntos han formado una familia con dos hijos de los cuales se encuentran estudiando Don Román trabaja en la construcción mientras que Doña Zenaida desde hace 21 años decidió ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar elaborando sus bordados para posteriormente venderlos, esta vez está solicitando crédito a la institución para comprar material como, tela, hilos de distintos colores, agujas especiales para la elaboración de sus artesanías como colchas, gabanes, chalecos, suéteres, etc. Doña Zenaida platica que dese muy pequeña ella veía como su mamá se dedicaba a la elaboración de estas artesanías le llamaba mucho la atención poco a poco viendo aprendió solo que algunos puntos como el de trencilla se le dificultaba elaborarlos pero afortunadamente pudo aprender con el tiempo, la señora Zenaida argumento: “Me gusta mucho realizar mi trabajo por una parte porque es una manera de ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos del hogar, con la educación de mis hijos pero por otra parte es para conservar nuestras artesanías ya que con el tiempo se han ido perdiendo muchas personas ya no valoran nuestro trabajo como nosotras quisiéramos”. Comenta esto porque no les pagan lo que realmente es el precio de la prenda. Doña Zenaida va a vender sus artesanías a una tienda de ropa en la capital ahí deja sus artesanías para que las escojan y regresa para ver si ya se vendieron solo que muchas veces no les regresan sus prendas ni su dinero y simplemente les dicen “la prenda se perdió” al parecer es la única manera de sacar a la venta sus artesanías porque estar ofreciendo de casa en casa o en otras comunidades es muy difícil que las compren y si las llegan a comprar es muy difícil que les paguen es por eso que llevan sus artesanías a una tienda de la capital.
Zenaida está muy contenta por el crédito otorgado porque le será de gran ayuda para comprar el material que le hace falta y así podrá seguir trabajando con la elaboración de sus prendas artesanales a Doña Zenaida le gustaría que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera profesional para que puedan tener un mejor sustento económico. Las integrantes del grupo son María de los Ángeles quien invertirá su crédito en productos de belleza, María Juana, Nancy, Zenaida, María de la Luz, Angelina ellas compraran material para la elaboración de sus artesanías. Ellas como Zenaida están muy agradecidas con KIVA y VisionFund por todos los créditos otorgados.
texts.en:
The communal bank Artesanas del Fresno has had several loan cycles with the institution. This time there are just six members, three who are new and three who have worked with the institution. The group chose its name based on the members' needlework.  Zenaida, a member, is 42 and has been married to Román for 21 years. Their two children are students. Román is a construction worker, and Zenaida decided 21 years ago to help her husband meet household expenses by doing needlework to sell. 

She is applying to the institution for a loan to buy materials such as fabric, different colors of thread, and special needles to make handicrafts like quilts, coats, vests, and jerseys. Zenaida says that, as a child, she carefully watched her mother make handicrafts and slowly learned the trade. Some techniques such as braiding were difficult, but she was able to learn them over time. Zenaida claims, “I like my work because it lets me help my husband with expenses and our children's education, but it also is a way to preserve our craftsmanship, which many people have lost because they don't appreciate our work as much as we would like." She feels this way because the selling price doesn't cover the cost of making the garments.

Zenaida will sell her garments to a clothing store in the capital. She can leave the merchandise there so the vendors can make a selection. She goes back to see if items have been sold because often the vendors don't return her garments or pay her and simply say that the garments were lost. It seems to be the only way to sell artesania, as selling door-to-door in other towns is very hard; if people buy, it's hard to collect payments. So, she takes her merchandise to the store in the capital.

Zenaida is happy to have the loan because it will allow her to buy the material she needs to keep creating handmade garments. Zenaida would love to see her children follow a professional career that would provide more income. The communal bank members are: María de los Ángeles, who will buy cosmetics, and María Juana, Nancy, Zenaida, María de la Luz, and Angelina, who will buy materials to make artesanía. Like Zenaida, they are grateful to KIVA and VisionFund for the loans.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, different colors of thread, and special needles to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 33 años esta casada y tiene dos hijos, a quienes desea poder brindarles una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida, viven juntos en su casa propia, lugar que logró comprar a base de esfuerzo y dedicación.El trabajo de Juana consiste en la venta de sábanas. Ofrece al público diversas prendas y accesorios de cama con diversos diseños, colores y modelos. Su clientela básicamente son sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, además de algunos nuevos clientes que siempre llegan ocasionalmente a su puesto de ventas. Algunas veces le solicitan pedidos con anticipación, los cuales reparte en el transcurso del día. Lleva trabajando 5 años en este rubro, actividad que realiza sola ya que su pareja busca ingresos de manera independiente.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para realizar otras actividades, además tiene independencia y dispone de su tiempo para dirigirse a zonas o lugares donde cree que realizará alguna venta , por ahora espera consolidar su negocio ya que tiene gran aceptación por los pobladores de su localidad.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 700 soles, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado comprará sábanas al por mayor en diversos modelos y colores.
texts.en:
Juana, 33, is married and has two children to whom she hopes to provide an education and better standard of living. They live in their own house, which she bought after much hard work. Juana sells sheets and other bedding items at retail in a variety of designs, colors, and styles. Her customers are mainly friends, relatives, and neighbors, along with new customers that come to her stand. She sometimes receives advance orders that she delivers that day.

She has been in business for five years and works alone. Her husband earns a living working independently. She likes her work because she has time to do other things. She also likes her independence and can schedule time to go to other places where she thinks she might make sales. She hopes to  strengthen her business based on the loyal customers in her area.

She is applying for a loan of S/. 700 soles, and she thanks all those who make it possible for her to keep working and seeing better results. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the loan to buy wholesale sheets in various styles and colors.

loans.use: to buy sheets.

loans.name: Enma Leonor

texts.es:
Emma vive en Libertad, tiene 27 años. Trabaja como comerciante ropa desde los 16 años de edad desde ese entonces le gusta lo que hace y escogió este trabajo por impulso propio. 

Este trabajo lo realiza sola, recorre todos los días vendiendo su mercadería de blusas, jeans, licras. Gracias a Dios por el momento no tiene ninguna dificultad.

Ella se separo de su esposo hace nueve meses atrás, ahora solo vive con su hijo que estudia en una escuela fiscal, quien es su esfuerzo para seguir adelante.

Con este préstamo quiere comprar pantalones, edredones, bludad. La clienta desea a futuro decorar su domicilio e incrementar más y mejor su negocio. Para así poder tener un bienestar propio.
texts.en: Emma, 27, lives in Libertad.  She’s been working as a clothing merchant since the age of 16 and has liked it ever since; she chose this line of work on her own.  She works by herself and goes from place to place every day selling her merchandise consisting of blouses, jeans and underwear.  Thanks to God she has no difficulties at present.  She separated from her husband nine months ago and now only lives with her son who attends a public school; he is her reason for striving to get ahead.  She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses and comforters.  She hopes in future to decorate her house and increase and improve her business to attain well-being of her own.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and comforters.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda has raised hogs in her village for more than 15 years. Aside from raising hogs, she is also engaged in the farming business growing rice crops on her one hectare of farmland. Imelda would like to ensure proper nutrition for her hogs. Due to the high cost of livestock supplies, she struggles to pay for them. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy necessary hog feed and vitamins. She hopes that her hogs will become healthier so she could receive higher prices for them. Her two children could finish their studies, giving them a brighter future, through her continuous access to financial services and her hard work.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase flour, sugar, margarine, etc. for her bakery business.

Dolly has been in this business for eight years. Dolly earns additional income from a general store and by raising livestock.

Dolly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, margarine, etc. for her business
